shots.desc: We're in a HELICOPTER POV flying over Hong Kong's dazzling skyline. SUPER - HONG KONG - JUNE 30, 1997 FADE UP the sound of a RADIO NEWSCAST as we continue to fly over luxury, high rise condos, gleaming corporate headquarters, and busy freeways.

sentences.line: (British accent) ...and now, in something less than three hours, what was once known as the Asian pearl of the British Empire will revert forever to The People's Republic of China...
sentences.followup: Suddenly, we break out of the lights of the city and FLY LOW over the dark harbor. The newscaster's voice blends with the WHUMP WHUMP of the chopper.

shots.desc: We're CLOSE on a huge gleaming DRAGON made of tin. The dragon seems to float effortlessly across a concrete warehouse floor. PULL BACK until we see that it's riding on a fork lift toward a SHIP docked at the warehouse. As the dragon moves, we see it pass PRICELESS CHINESE ART OBJECTS including ceramics, glass paintings, and huge statues. CHINESE MEN move quickly as they load this precious cargo into the hold of the ship.

The dragon is now descending right on top of us as it's lowered by A CRANE. A Chinese man carrying an AUTOMATIC WEAPON looks up at the dragon as he walks by. We hold on the dragon. Suddenly, A MAN'S FACE appears in the dragon's mouth. This is LEE, dressed all in black. He dives head first out of the dragon and lands silently on the deck.
Another GUARD, cradling an M-16, walks around a railing and looks over the side. Suddenly, A HAND reaches up and pulls him over the edge. He disappears and a beat later we HEAR A SPLASH.

He's coming up a LADDER, automatic weapon slung over his shoulder. He HEARS something, turns on the ladder. Nothing. When he starts back up WHACK! A foot kicks him off the ladder and the ship. SPLASH.
Lee dispatches them with a FLURRY OF HANDS. SPLASH, SPLASH.

A handsome Chinese man named SANG stands at the railing watching the loading process. He SHOUTS in MANDARIN and people jump to his command. Then something catches his eye. CLOSE ON The top of the warehouse. We see another man's FACE peer over the edge. And then disappear again.
Ten HONG KONG COPS, weapons at the ready, are spread out on the roof watching the loading action.

He turns and sees A HELICOPTER in the distance bearing down on the boat. Without showing any panic, Sang steps inside his ship office. He runs to his desk and grabs a REBREATHER MASK from a drawer. He looks up suddenly and sees Lee standing in the doorway. Sang doesn't move a muscle as the two men stare at each other. Suddenly AUTOMATIC GUNFIRE erupts everywhere as the raid beings. Sang dives for a Berretta taped under his desk. He grabs it and starts firing. Lee rolls across the office dodging bullets. Sang runs out and down a flight of steps. Lee follows on his heels.
A battle is in full progress as the Cops fire down on the bad guys. The helicopter joins the fray. We see a machine gun spray the warehouse from the chopper's open door.

Sang runs down another flight of steps, deeper in the bowels of the ship. He stops for an instant and fits the REBREATHER MASK over his face. Then he turns and fires four rounds at Lee who has to dive back in another passageway.

He comes hurtling down the steps. He stops. We hear nothing except the distant sound of GUNFIRE. Then faintly at first, we hear WATER SLOSHING. Lee walks down a dark passageway and stops. He looks down at a round HOLE in the deck, just big enough for a man. Dark harbor water SLOSHES in the hole.
Lee runs up on deck as the battle is ending. Police arrest dozens of bad guys. But Lee looks out at the water where one bad guy got away.

We're in a LARGE ORIENTAL GARDEN for a black tie dinner. Tuxedos and gowns. An assortment of worldly players. HAN, a handsome charismatic man is the focus of attention. He and his wife CHI-YING are at one of the tables. THOMAS GRIFFIN, 50, British, but warm and personable, has the floor. He is at Han's table, holding up a glass of bubbly.

sentences.line: -- because in my heart, I look upon it as a tragedy. Yes, ladies and gentlemen, a tragedy. (to Han) Forgive me, my friend. But I believe Hong Kong cannot afford to lose men of your character. It's understandable that China has envisioned a new role for you in the United States. But those of us here in law enforcement, can only look upon your leave-taking with sadness. And speaking personally, I will sorely miss your unbridled support of British Hong Kong Police. So, for all us Brits who ever carried a shield in Hong Kong... (lifts his glass) We will miss you, but we wish you nothing but happiness in America.
sentences.followup: The glasses clink. Lee, now dressed in a tuxedo, suddenly appears at Han's side. He whispers something in his ear. Han stands, glass in hand.

sentences.line: (to Griffin) Tom, thank you. Very much. (to the group) I am pleased to be able to leave you and Hong Kong with a gift tonight: less than an hour ago, Detective Lee and his special task force have once and for all crushed the Juntao Criminal Organization. Shock and then applause all around the table. This is the kind of legacy I have dreamed about: to leave this city safer than I found it. To Hong Kong...forever.
sentences.followup: Everyone drinks.

shots.desc: He's walking back up to the house when he senses someone behind him. He turns and receives a fist to the stomach. SOON YOUNG, Han's daughter is pissed.

sentences.line: When were you going to tell me you were not going with us?
I still have work to do here.
I don't believe you. My father was explaining to Mr. Griffin. That is how I found out.
I was trying to find the right time.
After I left?
sentences.followup: And she throws another punch at him. But he catches her hand. And holds it tightly, to keep from being hit again.

sentences.line: I am going to miss you very much, Soon Young. If I ever have a daughter, I hope she is like you. Soon Young yanks her hand away from him. She glares at him for a moment, then --
I will not have friends in America.
Soon Young, don't worry. You will have many friends very soon. You will see. America is a very friendly place.

shots.desc: We're somewhere in DOWNEY, CALIFORNIA looking at a VINTAGE DINER with a lot of glass windows all the way around it. We see two women seated in a booth, looking out at us.

One woman is SHIRLEY JOHNSON, beautiful, poised, generally not nervous like she is now. The other woman, LOIS, is in her early 20's, nasty looking, dangerous, and strung out. Both women are looking out into the parking lot. After a beat, Johnson gets up.

sentences.line: I gotta pee.
sentences.followup: She walks away. Lois watches her closely.

shots.desc: We're on JAMES CARTER mid twenties, dressed to impress. It doesn't appear to be working, however, because he has a GUN to his head.

sentences.line: You don't move, you understand?! You don't move!
Do I look like I'm movin'?! What you're seeing here? This is not movement. This is my "still".
sentences.followup: The man who is holding the gun is HENRY LAFONTAINE, thirty, shaved head, expensive clothes. Lafontaine pushes Carter until he's leaning forward on a parked JAGUAR. He starts patting Carter down. With his feet spread apart, hands spread on the trunk, Carter looks like a suspect who is being arrested. Lafontaine starts feeling around Carter's legs, moving higher up.

sentences.line: Hey, hey, you start touching me there, I'm gonna start movin'! Word up, mother...
(interrupting) Shut up!
You a cop or something?
Or somethin'.
sentences.followup: Lafontaine backs off, pulling the gun away from Carter's head.

sentences.line: Okay. Carter straightens himself.
relationship, stickin' a gun to a man's head, feelin' around his personal equipment. Make him think you don't trust him.
I don't trust anybody. Especially first time deals.
I oughta pat your ass down. Make sure you're not a cop.
Nobody touches me.
Shit, I ain't interested in puttin' my hands on you. That does nothin' for me. No. I don't need to be pattin' no ass. All I'm sayin' is, how do I know you're not a cop?
sentences.followup: Lafontaine opens the trunk of the JAGUAR. Inside are MANY SMALL WRAPPED PACKAGES with U.S. ARMY stenciled on them.

sentences.line: Because cops don't have the U.S. Government's finest...at my prices. Carter looks at the merchandise.
Ooooh. That's pretty.

shots.desc: JOHNSON is sitting in a stall, headphones on, talking into a transmitter.

sentences.line: OK, Carter, gimme something here. Start with the color of the packaging.

shots.desc: He sticks a pinky in one ear and scratches. INSERT A TINY MICROPHONE is in Carter's ear.

sentences.line: Yeah...beautiful. What would you call that paper there? Kind of a...Robin egg blue color? ON JOHNSON
(into the mike) Good. That's standard military packaging for plastique. Get a look under it. ON CARTER He leans over the packages and slits one open.
You know something? Every time I see this stuff, it reminds me of...uh...a double latte grande... (still looking) With two shots of non-fat milk.
What are you talking about? ON JOHNSON
(into the mike) That's it. High intensity C-4. We got his ass.
sentences.followup: CLICK. Carter looks up at a cute little silver plated .38 that Lois is pointing down on her from the next stall.

sentences.line: Step out slowly. Or I'll blow your hair style into the toilet. Where it belongs. ON CARTER He sees a wire coming out of one side of the package.
(speaking loudly) What's this little green wire coming out one side of the package?
I wouldn't touch that if I were you. Lafontaine pulls a remote DETONATOR out of his pocket.
I get the money, you get the detonator. (smiles) First date's are always scary. Lafontaine shuts the trunk. Hands the keys to Carter.
on the sidewalk. I'll leave the detonator on my side. Then we trade places. Get the picture?
Hey, honey...
sentences.followup: Lafontaine turns to see Johnson, who's wearing a sexy short skirt, walking toward them with Lois bringing up the rear.

sentences.line: She talks to herself on the potty.
sentences.followup: Lois shoves Johnson ahead, revealing the GUN in one hand and Johnson's TRANSMITTER in the other.

sentences.line: (to Lafontaine ) Let's kill her. (cocking the .38) I'll flip you for it.
sentences.followup: Lafontaine turns to Carter, but Carter is already throwing a punch. Connecting. Lafontaine falls. The remote drops as Lois FIRES at Carter. The bullet ricochets off the car. Lafontaine sees the remote, makes a dive for it. But another hand gets there first. Lois turns the gun on Johnson.

sentences.line: No!
sentences.followup: Carter is holding the detonator. Stand-off. Carter grabs Lafontaine. Pulls him up. Lois grabs Johnson, pulls her back by her hair, shoves the gun to her head. She's going to shoot anyway.

sentences.line: Lois, don't!
sentences.followup: Lois has the look of a child who hates to be told she can't do something. Johnson looks at Carter. She offers the best I'm sorry she can muster with her eyes.

sentences.line: Put the gun down.
After you're dead. I promise. Carter tightens his grip around Lafontaine's throat.
Okay, look, we're gonna make a trade. You cross the street, leave her on the sidewalk. I will leave him on this him, I get her. Get the picture, Lois?
(to Lois) Do it!

shots.desc: Lois leads Johnson across the street. Gun to her side. When she gets to the sidewalk, she turns, looks back at Carter. He's on the opposite side, holding Lafontaine. Lois starts back across the street. Dodging traffic. And Carter does the same, detonator in hand. Carter and Lois cross toward each other. HORNS HONK. But getting hit by a car is the least of their worries. They stare at each other as they cross traffic. Lois wants to kill Carter. She's got that look. Johnson and Lafontaine wait on opposite sides. Then as Carter and Lois are almost opposite each other --

sentences.line: Kill him!
sentences.followup: Lafontaine starts running. Carter moves. Lois starts shooting. Hitting cars, smashing windshields. Cars careen into each other. Carter jumps over one, almost hit by another. Lois is in the middle of the street, firing at Carter. Another windshield hit. Car swerving. Carter falls, the detonator skidding away. Across the lane. Carter is in direct line of fire. And she takes aim as a TRUCK RUNS OVER THE DETONATOR. AN EXPLOSION roars in the parking lot. The Jaguar and SIX OTHER CARS go up in a ball of fire. Lois is knocked into the street. The diner windows ALL BLOW OUT AT ONCE. Carter SEES Lafontaine running for a car stopped on the street. Lafontaine pulls open the door, grabs the driver. Then Lafontaine looks up and SEES -- Carter APPEARING THROUGH THE SMOKE. Running toward him. Lafontaine drops the driver, swings at Carter, but Carter tackles him, slamming him into the car. Lafontaine tries to throw a punch. But Carter spins him around and shoves him into the car window, head first. Window shattering. Lafontaine is out. Carter pulls him out of the car. Lafontaine slumps. Carter kneels next to him, pulling out his identification.

sentences.line: Los Angeles Police. You are under arrest. Anything you say may be used to put your ass in jail, you piece of
sentences.followup: Carter sits down next to Lafontaine. He's tired and hurting. Johnson runs up, gun in hand.

sentences.line: You okay?
sentences.followup: Johnson kneels down next to him. Her short skirt hikes up her legs. Carter looks at one of her thighs.

sentences.line: Not anymore.
Where'd you get it?
sentences.followup: Carter looks at Johnson and points to his heart. She suddenly looks pissed.

sentences.line: Oh, give it up!

shots.desc: A large entrance to the Ambassador's Residence. Han is waiting by the door, briefcase in hand, as Soon Young sweeps down the grand stairway, backpack over one shoulder, lunch bag in hand. She stops at the bottom of the stairs.

sentences.line: I forgot -- (races back upstairs) -- something.
sentences.followup: Han starts to protest, but... what's the use? He looks at his watch. Then up at Chi-Ying as she comes down the stairs.

sentences.line: Will somebody please tell our daughter that I am the Ambassador?
sentences.followup: Chi-Ying just shrugs. Nothing can be done about it.

shots.desc: ESTABLISHING. FLAG of PEOPLES REPUBLIC OF CHINA hanging from a standard. A MERCEDES waiting in front. DRIVER and BODY GUARD with the car. Han and Soon Young finally appear. Heading for the car. Soon Young gets into the back seat. And just as Han is about to get in next to her, Chi-Ying comes out after him. CHI-YING Telephone. China. The Ambassador holds up his hands in exasperation. What's a guy to do?

sentences.line: Drop her off, then come back. (to Body Guard) Go with them. (to Soon Young) I love you.
sentences.followup: Han kisses Soon Young on the cheek, then gets out of the car and rushes back into the house. Chi-Ying waves to Soon Young as the car pulls out of the driveway.

shots.desc: Han puts down his briefcase, picks up the phone.

sentences.line: (into phone; in Chinese) This is Han... (in English) Hello? Hello?
sentences.followup: Nothing. Han replaces the phone with a troubled expression.

shots.desc: The MERCEDES makes its way down tree-lined streets. Houses, cars, very few people -- this is a very affluent neighborhood. It turns onto a bridge leading down into the Beverly Hills FLATS. A WELCOME TO THE CITY OF BEVERLY HILLS sign flashes past.
key_words: WELCOME TO THE CITY OF BEVERLY HILLS

shots.desc: Soon Young leans forward and inserts a CD into the deck. As the music comes on she flips the dial to maximum -- total chaos. The sounds of R&B/HIP HOP fill the car. FRONT SEAT The Bodyguard and driver look at one another -- what is that racket? The bodyguard turns around and reaches through the partition lowering the volume. Soon Young turns the music back up. The bodyguard reaches through and turns it down again. She leans forward, pushing the bodyguard away and turns the music back up. A staring contest. She slams the privacy glass shut in his face. The bodyguard shakes his head turns back around.

The Mercedes turns onto Wilshire Boulevard where cars are backed up at least two blocks. Farther ahead, a PIGGY BACK OIL TRUCK has jack knifed and turned over, blocking traffic in both directions. Cops mill around trying to create order out of chaos. The driver checks the rearview: Too late, more cars stacking behind him. Up ahead an ASIAN traffic cop diverts cars onto Dayton Way. The driver nudges the bodyguard, points at the wreck.

sentences.line: (in Mandarin) LA drivers.
sentences.followup: The car inches onto Dayton Way. A SECOND TRAFFIC COP directs them onto Rodeo. As the Mercedes pulls alongside him, the bodyguard notices he's Asian too.

shots.desc: A DELIVERY VAN waits as the Mercedes stops at the corner. The passenger door opens and an Asian MAN slides out, traffic cop uniform, white gloves, glasses, hat pulled low.
Soon Young barely pays attention as she watches the cop knock on the bodyguard's window.
The bodyguard cautiously lowers the glass.

sentences.line: Yes, officer?
sentences.followup: The Cop leans in as if to speak, BOOM! Blows him away. The bodyguard slumps forward. BOOM! The driver gets it. We see now the cop is SANG. IN THE REAR Soon Young is shocked but she thinks fast, scoots across the seat as Sang jerks the door open. She flies out the other door, he manages to get a handful of backpack, she quickly wriggles free, slams the door shut behind her and starts running.

shots.desc: She turns around, sees Sang making his way OVER the car. She runs through traffic towards a shopping structure, 2 Rodeo Dr. Sang curses when he sees he can't reach her and heads back to the van.

Soon Young runs around the corner breathing hard. She hugs the edge of the building. Peeks back around. Sees a van making a sharp U-turn, headed her way. She starts across the cobblestones. BEHIND HER, a MOTORCYCLE pulls out. She's in the middle of the street. The biker scoops her up under his left arm, pulls onto Rodeo. THE DELIVERY VAN Screeches up.

He jumps out and opens the back of the van. Soon Young takes a SWING AT HIM. Sang grabs her arm easily and then viciously PUNCHES HER, sending her flying back into the van. Sang slams the doors. Trots to the front. They pull out. LITTLE SANTA MONICA -- the van and motorcycle head off in separate directions.

UNMARKED CARS roar down the road, racing up to the residence. TWO CARS stay on the street outside. SEVERAL MEN IN SUITS get out, head for the residence. Some lugging equipment. In the lead is AGENT IN CHARGE, WARREN RUSS. The door opens, they enter.
Ambassador Han greets them. He has obviously been through great strain, but maintains his composure.

sentences.line: Ambassador, I'm Warren Russ, FBI Agent in Charge. This is Agent Whitney.
sentences.followup: DAN WHITNEY, thirty-eight, ex-football type, solid American, shakes hands with the Ambassador.

sentences.line: I know this is a difficult time but...
(interrupting) You can set up in my office.

shots.desc: Office off the main entrance. Elegantly furnished. Chinese Flag. Political photographs. The FBI is already setting up equipment. Tapping phone lines. Han watches them for a moment as his personal life is pushed aside and the Feds take over. Then he approaches Russ.

sentences.line: I would like one of my people to help.
Ambassador, let me assure you that the FBI has made this a top priority. We have plenty of manpower on the case.
He is very good.
As I said, sir, we've got all the people we need. Russ turns away.
I am not an American, Mr. Russ. My daughter is not an American.
I understand, sir. But you are an honored guest of the United States...
(interrupting) He is already on the plane. I hope you will treat him with the same respect you have shown me.
sentences.followup: Russ stares at Han, not sure how to handle this situation. Mr. Han bows and exits. Leaving Russ at a loss. Whitney comes up behind him.

sentences.line: What was that all about?
He wants his own man.
What?!

shots.desc: The entrance is UNDERGROUND and very busy. Carter and Johnson pull up in the sedan.
Overloaded DETECTIVES at desks. Trying to solve too many crimes in a city with too many bad people. Din of PHONES, KEYBOARDS, VOICES. A pissed off Johnson enters in front of Carter.

sentences.line: You're killin' me here.
Carter, just because you saved my butt, doesn't mean it's yours.
Oh, baby, you cruel...
sentences.followup: Johnson enters a small office right across from Carter's desk where he now plops down. TWO DETECTIVES walk up.

sentences.line: Heard about what happened over there at the diner. Nice work.
(laughing) Not everybody gets to blow up a city block.
Don't worry about it. Nobody liked the food there anyway.
Probably give you a medal. For urban renewal. Both Detectives slap hands and laugh.
That's good. What did you two do? Work that up in the men's room while you were playing with each other?
sentences.followup: The cops stop laughing. They walk away when Carter's phone rings.

sentences.line: Carter... Yeah... uh-huh...now? Okay. He hangs up and looks at Johnson in her office.
Captain wants to see me.
(melting) Last night's as much my fault as yours. If he's gonna put the blame on anybody --
Hey, I was senior. It's OK. This is why I get the big bucks.
sentences.followup: Carter gets up and crosses toward the CAPTAIN'S OFFICE in the corner of the room. A brave man facing the Lion's den. Even Johnson can't help but admire his courage.

shots.desc: WILLIAM DIEL is behind his desk. Diel is fifty, professional, doesn't smile a lot. He's not smiling now. Carter enters.

sentences.line: I don't know what went wrong last night, but this department could've lost one detective and our only explosives expert.
Sir, I can explain.
What you did was dangerous and completely outside policy.
I know, but --
That's probably the only reason Johnson's still alive. This takes Carter a little by surprise.
Good job.
Hey, sir, it was a pleasure to preserve Johnson's ass. (pause) Well...you know what I mean.
I got a call from the F.B.I. The daughter of the Chinese Ambassador has been kidnapped and they asked for help. You're it. Carter straightens his posture a bit.
Feds asked for me?
They asked for the best street man I had. Carter tries to be humble, but... damn, that's hard.
And that, of course, would be me.
Don't push it. You better watch your ass with these Fed types. If there's a screw-up, they won't think twice about burnin' it.

shots.desc: Carter exits Diel's office, crosses back through the desks to his own. Johnson comes out of her office.

sentences.line: What happened? Carter just packs up his stuff.
Did he fire you? He can't fire you! Carter puts a hand on her shoulder.
Hey, baby, it's cool. Captain just reassigned me to the Feds.
The Feds?!
FBI needs a taste of the street. And I'm it. Carter returns to packing up his stuff.
Way he put it, I was the only one he thought could handle it. But you know what the worst thing is?
(caught up in it) No...what?
I could get promoted right out of here.
What's wrong with that?
I wouldn't be close to you. (sniffing) What is that perfume, girl? Johnson comes back to reality.
No matter how many times you go undercover, you still come out an asshole.

shots.desc: Unmarked car pulls up in front of the Chinese Consulate. Carter sticks his badge out the window to FBI Agents. Carter is wearing shades.

sentences.line: Detective James Carter. L.A.P.Deee.
sentences.followup: One of the Agents relays the information via his radio. Then they open the gates. Carter drives in.

shots.desc: Carter enters. The place is under FBI control. But everything's gonna be okay now. Carter's here. Carter is the only one not in a dark suit. Interviews of all staff being conducted in one room - we get a glimpse as a door opens and an AGENT with an EAR PLUG exits. Carter gives the Agent a knowing nod.

sentences.line: (re: ear plug) Oh yeah, gotta get me one a those.
sentences.followup: Sees ANOTHER FBI AGENT with a high-powered rifle move past.

sentences.line: Ooo, there's a chill. Love that.
Carter.
sentences.followup: Carter sees Whitney motioning him into the office.

shots.desc: Carter enters. Lots of activity. All electronic equipment is up and running. AGENTS are testing the PHONE TAPE. Russ is on the phone as Carter walks up.

sentences.line: (into phone) ...yes, sir, I understand. I'll do my best...but there is a question of authority, sir... yes, sir, okay.
sentences.followup: Russ hangs up. Turns to Carter. Carter nods. Confident that Russ knows he's the man for the job.

sentences.line: Carter. I'm Russ. Agent in charge.
sentences.followup: Carter eyes him. The suit, the hair, the shine on the shoes. Russ holds out his hand. They shake.

sentences.line: Any demands yet?
At this point we don't have much.
RUSS (ignoring him) You come highly recommended, Carter. And your particular assignment requires a special talent.
Interrogation is one a my specialties, but undercover work is my forte.
sentences.followup: Everything about Carter changes; posture, language, attitude, as he morphs into a gang drug supplier.

sentences.line: Yo, bro, y'cruisin' fo da go-dee on da hi, u be comin' to da ri-man, say what. [or something to this effect]
sentences.followup: Russ stares at Carter for a moment. Carter quickly changes back to himself.

sentences.line: Never knew I was a man in blue.

shots.desc: Russ and Carter exit.

sentences.line: ... the director considers this top priority, considering he is a Chinese National and here under difficult circumstances. His name is Lee. And he is to be shown every courtesy. Within reason.
Sir, he's just gonna get in my way. If I'm gonna handle this situation...
(interrupting) He is the situation. Carter stops walking.
I'm talking about the girl.
Don't worry about the kidnapping, Carter, the F.B.I. will handle that. Your assignment is Lee. Carter hesitates a moment, trying to sort this thing out.
What kind of assignment is that? Bottom line: I don't want some Chung King Cop getting his head blown off and turning this operation into a international incident.
(getting hot) Why don't you assign one of your own men to this?
Because with your special talents, I'm sure you'll do a better job.
What the hell am I supposed to do with him? Take him to the zoo?

Just make him think you're following leads. Interview some suspects, look at fingerprints, do detective shit. I don't care. I just don't want to see him- or you, for that matter- until this is resolved. (hands Carter a file) Now, we want to make a good impression, don't we? His plane lands in an hour. Don't be late.
sentences.followup: End of conversation. Russ returns to the house. Carter sizzles.

shots.desc: Carter's unmarked car pulls into one of the POLICE ZONES.
Carter looks at his watch. His mobile phone rings.

sentences.line: Yeah. INTERCUT WITH JOHNSON She's at her desk.
So how'd it go? Carter perks up when he hears Johnson's voice.
How'd what go?
With the FBI. What do you think I'm talking about? Carter puts on some exuberance.

Oh, you're not gonna believe what they put me in charge of. They sent for the Ambassador's personal Chinese Investigator type. He is like the baddest Asian shield they got. And I, let me repeat that, I am the man who is on the case with him. Just the two of us, alone, workin' the whole deal as a team.
They put you in charge?
In Charge. Just me'n him. No interference. They don't even want to hear from us until we're done. I love the F.B.I. I love the F.B.I.
Well...listen, if you need any help, you know, back up, call me, OK?
Oh baby, don't worry, I'll call you. You can count on it.
OK. Well...make us proud. And be careful.
sentences.followup: That takes a little of the wind out of Carter's sails. We can see it in his face, but he tries his best not to let her hear it over the phone.

sentences.line: Yeah, thanks. He hangs up and mutters to himself.
Yeah, gotta be careful. Might get run over by a Sky Cap.

shots.desc: The CHINESE AIRLINES JET lands.
Carter is waiting at the GATE, the only one who could bypass Customs. He's watching a parade of ASIAN PASSENGERS deplane, heading for Customs.

sentences.line: Mr. Lee. Is there a Mr. Lee on the (no response) Does anybody know Mr. Lee? (no response) Mr. Lee from China.
sentences.followup: Carter is losing his patience. Passengers continue to deplane. But their ranks are thinning.

sentences.line: Mr. Lee.
sentences.followup: Finally the last of the last. An ELDERLY ASIAN MAN AND WOMAN.

sentences.line: Mr. and Mrs. Lee? They look at him, smile, but continue past.
I don't believe this! First I get stuck with this --
sentences.followup: LEE moves down the ramp and stops as he HEARS CARTER'S VOICE --

sentences.line: -- lame ass assignment, now the sonuvabitch doesn't even show up. This is bullshit! Ain't my fault if this limpdick can't make his plane.
sentences.followup: Carter is about to leave when Lee exits the ramp. Looking at Carter. And Carter looks at him.

sentences.line: Mr. Lee? Lee smiles and bows politely.
You got bags?
sentences.followup: No response from Lee. Carter assumes he can't speak English.

sentences.line: Oh shit, you gotta be kiddin'. Carter holds out his FBI IDENTIFICATION.
You speaky Eng-lish? Lee looks at Carter for a moment, then smiles and nods.
Yeah, right, sure, uh-huh.

shots.desc: This is his first time to America. And despite the reason, he can't help but look.

sentences.line: First thing I gotta do is check you in. So we have to go to L.A.P.D. H.Q. (checking Lee ) You understand what I'm saying? A beat, then Lee says:
(slowly) You talk very fast.
Okay, I'll slow down. (just as fast) So we go downtown and we ask you a few questions... you know, like what's your name? How old are you? You ever expose yourself in public...shit like that.
sentences.followup: Carter waits to see if he's getting through. Lee just nods. Carter is convinced he's just talking to himself.

sentences.line: Yeah, good, we also will ask if you have ever worn pink frilly underwear...and what the hell is the attraction of Karaoke to Asian Peoples?
sentences.followup: Lee nods as if he understands everything. Carter sighs. It's gonna be a long assignment. Lee points to the RADIO.

sentences.line: You want the radio? RAY-DEE-OHHH. Lee nods.
Why not? Beats talking shit to myself.
sentences.followup: Lee smiles, nods. Carter turns on the radio. A BEACH BOYS SONG comes on.

sentences.line: Oh no... Carter reaches for the radio, but Lee holds out his hand.
Beach Boy.
You're shittin' me. You know the Beach Boys?! Beach Boy America. (starts singing) Help me Rhonda, help me get her out of my -- Carter listens to Lee sing along for a moment, then --

Beach Boy America my ass. You don't look like a Beach Boy, you don't sound like a Beach Boy. And your singin' ability is only gonna make me do something that I could get the death penalty for. You want America, here's America.
sentences.followup: Carter changes the station. RAP MUSIC. Carter drums along with the bass line. Moving his body to the beat, to make sure he shows the effect of the rhythm.

sentences.line: Tell me you can do this to the Beach Boys.
sentences.followup: Lee listens, trying hard to get it. He doesn't. He pushes the other button back to HELP ME RHONDA.

sentences.line: (smiles) Help me Rhonda.
(incensed) Let me give you a piece of advice: never touch another man's radio. You do it again, nobody, not Rhonda, not Yolanda, gonna save your ass. Carter pushes the button back to Rap.
That is America, got it? That is America.

shots.desc: Han is reviewing PHOTOGRAPHS with Whitney and Russ.

sentences.line: -- operating out of San Francisco, has been associated with one of the Triads. This group was identified as having entered the United States two months ago --
sentences.followup: The PHONE RINGS. Attention turns to the desk. Russ stands.

sentences.line: (to Han) Remember: try and keep him on the phone as long as you can. Ask to speak with your daughter. Ask how she is... anything.
sentences.followup: They cross to the desk. Han hesitates. Nervous. FOURTH RING. He picks up the phone.

sentences.line: Hello.
Han?
Yes.
It's Griffin.
Griffin? Where are you.
sentences.followup: Han turns to Russ. Russ mouths Do you know him? Han nods.

sentences.line: Still in Hong Kong. But I'm afraid this is not a social call. I have just learned some disturbing information. There is going to be an attempt to kidnap you or a member of your family. I don't know when. And I'm not sure by whom. But I trust my sources. You should contact the F.B.I. immediately. They'll know what to do.
I am afraid your source was very good. They have Soon-Young.
Oh God, no. I'm so sorry, my friend. Russ picks up the phone.
This is Special Agent Russ, Federal Bureau of Investigation. Would you please identify yourself?

shots.desc: Overlooking downtown Hong Kong. Griffin is next to the window, phone in hand, looking out at the lights of the city.

sentences.line: Yes, of course. My name is Thomas Ian Griffin, former commander of British I are old and close friends. He will confirm this. But the information I have just relayed to you is sensitive. I'm sure you understand that I cannot provide details over a telephone. But in lieu of Soon Young's...situation, I'll be on the next flight to Los Angeles.

shots.desc: Carter leads Lee toward the FRONT DESK. Holds up ID and motions to Lee.

sentences.line: He's with me.
sentences.followup: Lee looks at the OFFICER, offering a short bow and a polite smile. The Officer isn't used to such polite behavior. Can't help a smile back. Carter sees the exchange. Makes him wanna puke. He leads Lee to the ELEVATOR. They get in.

shots.desc: Carter and Lee enter. Doors close. They're alone.

sentences.line: You carry a gun?
sentences.followup: Lee looks at Carter as if questioning. Carter has no patience.

sentences.line: A gun, a gun!
sentences.followup: Carter reaches for his weapon, but suddenly Lee's hands move with lightening speed - and Carter is suddenly staring at HIS OWN GUN IN LEE'S HANDS.

sentences.line: What're you doing?! I wasn't gonna shoot you! I was trying to explain -- ah shit, give me the god damn gun.
sentences.followup: Lee hesitates, then smiles and gives the gun back. Carter fumes. Holds up his gun.

sentences.line: You have one of these?
No.
(holstering the gun) Yeah, well you're in American now. Everybody's got guns. That tricky shit with your hands is gonna get your
sentences.followup: Lee smiles. Carter turns away. They ride in silence. Suddenly Carter goes for his gun again. And Lee's hands fly into action. And once again -- Carter is staring at HIS OWN GUN IN LEE'S HANDS. Now Carter is really pissed. But Lee smiles and hands the gun back. Carter forces a smile. Takes the gun.

sentences.line: You try that shit on me one more time, I'll kick your ass. You understand that? You know what kick your ass means? Lee smiles, nods.
I'll bet you do.
sentences.followup: The ELEVATOR STOPS. Doors open. Carter motions politely for Lee to exit first and which direction to go.

key_words: HIS OWN GUN IN LEE'S HANDS

shots.desc: Lee exits. Carter comes out behind him. Takes a couple of steps. Passing OTHER DETECTIVES getting onto the elevators. Carter follows Lee, a step behind. Then he goes for his gun again. Lee, as if he has eyes in the back of his head, spins, kicks. And Carter is on his back, staring at the ceiling. Looking at his gun in Lee's hands. Lee holds out his hand to help Carter up. Suddenly we HEAR --

sentences.line: Put the gun down now!
sentences.followup: Carter and Lee turn. A DETECTIVE has his gun leveled at Lee from ten feet away - obviously mistaking the situation.

sentences.line: Put it down!
It's alright. He's with me.
With you? He's pointing a goddamn gun at you. You call that with you? And now it's Lee's turn to speak - in perfect English.
He was just showing me how to take a gun away from a suspect.
sentences.followup: Carter looks at Lee in disbelief. Lee flips the gun around and hands it back to Carter, butt first. Carter takes the gun, anger building.

sentences.line: You must be a helluva teacher.
Oh yes, he's very good.
(to Carter) Just don't do that shit in the hallway. I could've killed him.
Oh yeah, maybe next time you will.
sentences.followup: Lee smiles at the Detective and bows as they move past. The Detective can't help but return the smile. Carter is pissed.

shots.desc: Carter bursts into the men's room. Lee follows him in.

sentences.line: You speak English!
A little.
Bullshit a little. You lied to me.
I didn't say I didn't. You assumed I didn't.
It's the same thing!
I am not responsible for your assumptions.
You're full of shit. Do you understand what I'm saying to you? Full of shit?
Not being able to speak is not the same as not speaking. You seemed as if you liked to talk. I like to let people talk who like to talk. It makes it easier to find out how full of shit they are.
Okay, fine, you're full a shit, I'm full a shit.
We are both full of shit.
Yeah, that's right. Now that we understand each other... show me how you did that.
sentences.followup: Carter pantomimes Lee's fast hands. Whipping them around in a frenzy of activity. Lee just watches Carter's pathetic attempt to mimic him for a moment, then:

sentences.line: You should keep your gun.

shots.desc: Carter is sitting on one side, Lee on the other. Carter is handing him a bunch of brochures and information.

sentences.line: ... and there's a copy of our insurance packages.
sentences.followup: Carter hands another folder to Lee. Lee stares at the material. But it's obvious he's losing patience himself.

sentences.line: I am afraid I don't understand the importance of this information.

Look, you want to work in this country, you gotta know this crap. Okay? We're gonna be in some deep shit here. Working the danger zone. And you need insurance. Cause, you know, you might be starting some riots and shit.
sentences.followup: But Carter sees Johnson coming toward him. And he quickly puts on the positive.

sentences.line: So, my plan is, we hit the scene, walk it --
sentences.followup: Lee doesn't know what the hell Carter is talking about. Johnson glances at Lee, then Carter.

sentences.line: -- and get the feel for how it went down. Then hit the witnesses --
sentences.followup: Carter sees Johnson, smiles, waves. Lee turns to look, but Carter goes quickly back to talking, as if what he has to say is too important to interrupt.

sentences.line: action went down.
sentences.followup: Johnson watches for a moment, then she moves past. Realizing the conversation is too important to interrupt. But she smiles at Lee.

sentences.line: Because we gotta dig up the -- And Lee smiles at Johnson.
-- what the hell is that?
What?
That silly-ass look on your face.
I was being polite.
Well don't do that. Polite don't work here. You do that polite shit here in America, they'll sue your ass for harassment.
sentences.followup: Lee just stares at Carter. America, according to Carter, is not what he expected. But now that Johnson is safely past:

sentences.line: Where were we?
Witnesses.

Wait. You hungry? You gotta be hungry, you just flew in from China. And what'd they feed you, Chinese food, right? Then you gotta be hungry. Hell, it doesn't matter, I'm hungry. We'll get some food on the way to the Consulate.

shots.desc: A HOT DOG STAND out in front. Carter is handed TWO HOT DOGS by the COOK. Gives one to Lee.

sentences.line: It's not really dog. Just called a dog. Not like in Vietnam where if they made one a these it'd be dog. It's just made from... well, I'm not sure what, but there ain't no dog in it.
sentences.followup: They move down the street and Carter gestures to the wild quasi-Chinese architecture of the old Grauman Theatre.

sentences.line: Just like home, huh? I never been to China, but... (looks at Lee) ... I guess this must be pretty much it, huh? Dragons and shit. Lee just stares at the garish design. He is not happy.
I thought you were taking me to the consulate.
Oh yeah, but this is on the way. And you gotta see John Wayne's footprints. Everybody does. It's almost like a law. You can't believe how small his feet were for a dude that big. Tiny god damn feet!
sentences.followup: Carter leads Lee to the foot prints in cement. But a BUS LOAD OF ASIAN TOURISTS starts to move in, swirling around. Carter looks at the foot prints for a beat, really getting tired of this job. Then he turns to Lee and... is CONFRONTED BY THE BUS LOAD OF ASIANS. Lee is no where to be seen.

sentences.line: Lee? (no Lee) Lee!
sentences.followup: A COUPLE of the ASIAN TOURISTS turn to him. Carter starts searching through the tourists. Trying to pick him out. Lee moves quickly through the Asians, smiling and commenting on the concrete memorials, just like he's a tourist. And Carter can't pick him out.

sentences.line: Lee!
sentences.followup: Carter suddenly sees him. His back to us. Grabs him from behind and spins him around.

sentences.line: Hey, I was callin' -- Then he realizes it's not Lee.
Shit! Where'd he go?! LEE!
sentences.followup: As Carter turns and confronts more ASIAN FACES, we SEE LEE slip past him in the b.g. This ain't funny, man. I know you're in there! Carter turns, SEES ANOTHER BUS LOAD OF ASIAN PEOPLE unloading.

sentences.line: Oh no, man, no!
sentences.followup: Carter pushes through the tourists. And finally SEES Lee across the street, hailing a cab. Carter can't believe it.

sentences.line: Hey! What're you doin'?!
sentences.followup: Lee turns, sees Carter. The cab is still too far away to get into. So Lee goes running after it.

sentences.line: Hey! Hey!
sentences.followup: Carter takes off after him.

key_words: CONFRONTED BY THE BUS LOAD OF
SEES ANOTHER BUS LOAD OF ASIAN PEOPLE

shots.desc: Lee darts right across traffic - gymnastically moving through the flow of traffic. HORNS HONK. A car skids to a stop, almost hitting him, but Lee vaults over it. Carter sees the maneuver, can't believe it. Continues after him, trying not to get flattened.

sentences.line: Come back here!
sentences.followup: Lee grabs onto the back of a MOVING BUS, climbs up on top. FROM ATOP THE BUS Lee looks back at Carter. Carter is pouring on the speed, catching up to the bus. He's going to catch Lee. Lee looks off the side at ANOTHER BUS COMING THE OPPOSITE DIRECTION. CARTER lunges at the bus, grabbing hold.

sentences.line: Don't do this! You're gonna get hurt! We're going to the Consulate, right now, I swear --
sentences.followup: Carter climbs up just in time to see -- LEE -- leap from the bus to the OTHER BUS moving in the opposite direction. He lands hard, grabbing hold. CARTER opposite direction. Carter starts back down the bus as fast as he can, jumping the last four feet, right into the path of a CAR, which swerves to avoid hitting him, into the path of ANOTHER CAR. HORNS HONK. CARS SWERVE. Carter runs down Hollywood Blvd. toward La Brea as we SEE -- LEE -- JUMP ONTO THE TOP OF A MOVING VAN which is next to the Bus. Then jumps from the VAN to a GARBAGE TRUCK just making the turn down La Brea. Disappearing around the corner.

shots.desc: Carter reaches the corner in time to watch the Garbage Truck heading toward Sunset Blvd. But he can't give up. What would he tell Russ? He lost his assignment? He starts running after the Garbage Truck. And as Carter runs past CAMERA CRANES ACROSS TO ANOTHER DELIVERY TRUCK moving the opposite direction. And ON TOP OF THE DELIVERY TRUCK is Lee, staying low, watching Carter run his poor tired ass off in the wrong direction. Lee looks around quickly. A YELLOW CAB is moving down the cross street.
key_words: CAMERA CRANES ACROSS TO ANOTHER DELIVERY TRUCK
ON TOP OF THE DELIVERY TRUCK

shots.desc: The DRIVER is cruising when a MAN seems to DROP from the sky right in front of him. The Driver slams on the brakes and skids to a stop at a smiling Lee.
The taxi pulls up in front and Lee exits. Heads for the entrance. TWO FBI AGENTS (WILLIS and GEIGER) watching. One speaks into a HEADPHONE.

sentences.line: (into headset) We have a man in a taxi. License plate 2NRB 998. About five ten. Asian.

shots.desc: Whitney gets the call. Turns to Russ. Coffee cups and take out food spread around.

sentences.line: Got someone dropped off by a cab. Asian.
sentences.followup: Everyone perks up.

shots.desc: FBI Agent Geiger stops Lee.

sentences.line: Can I help you?
Help. Yes. I must see the Ambassador.
About what?
May I please see him? It is very important. FBI Agent Willis walks up.
Why don't you tell us why you need to see the Ambassador? We'll decide if it's important.
It is about his daughter, Soon Young. That's the magic word. Things happen fast.
Hands on top of your head!
(into head set) He asked about the Ambassador's daughter. FBI Agent Geiger reaches for his gun. And Lee reacts.

shots.desc: WHITNEY He asked about the daughter.

sentences.line: Get em!
sentences.followup: BACK TO LEE AND THE TWO AGENTS Both agents are on the ground looking up at Lee who is holding their guns. Wondering what happened. And sure they are about to die.

sentences.line: (into head set) Code nine, code nine!
sentences.followup: The agents are frozen, fear on their faces. It looks like Lee is going to kill them. But suddenly he throws their guns into the bushes.

sentences.line: You just don't understand. I was invited.
sentences.followup: Lee moves toward the entrance and SEES SIX MORE AGENTS coming at him. Lee can't believe it. What is going on?!

sentences.line: There he is!
sentences.followup: Lee darts across the driveway and around the corner of the house.

key_words: BACK TO LEE AND THE TWO AGENTS

shots.desc: He runs across a patio. Suddenly, a side door on the house opens and TWO AGENTS run into his path. WITHOUT BREAKING STRIDE, he twirls and takes one of them out with a kick. The second throws one punch, two and hits AIR. Lee chops four times and the guy ends up in a hedge. Whitney, Geiger and Williams come around a corner. The agent lying on the patio points.

sentences.line: He went up!
sentences.followup: They look up at a WALL on the side of the house. Beyond it is the Consulate Compound.

sentences.line: (into mike) Secure the area!

shots.desc: Lee is below the wall, in the bushes, silently making his way into the large back yard area. He hears someone coming. He hops up onto one of the Jacaranda Trees and starts climbing.
The Agents run into the house, head for the doors. Whitney runs up the stairs. Other agents behind.
The Ambassador is pacing. Chi-Ying is sitting. She has been crying. The commotion outside finally reaches them. We HEAR MEN YELLING. The door bursts open. Whitney enters.

sentences.line: I'm sorry, sir, we have an unauthorized entry. Please get away from the windows!

shots.desc: Lee crawls along the steeply pitched roof looking for a way in. He gets to a GABLE with a WINDOW. But before he can look inside, an AGENT sticks his head out the window and looks around. The agent turns to his left. Nothing. He turns to his right and there's Lee, smiling at him. POW. Lee connects with a right and the agent ACCIDENTALLY FALLS out the window. Lee freaks and DIVES for the guy as he slides down the roof.
They're walking in the back yard, guns drawn. Something makes one of them look up. AGENTS POV The guy from the window, still out cold, is dangling off the edge of the house.

He's out of sight, still on the roof, holding the guy's collar and keeping him from falling over the edge. He peaks down at the agents and then lets the guy go. He lands on the two agents like a bomb, knocking both of them down. Lee jumps off the roof and starts running across the huge lawn. Three agents come out of the POOL HOUSE and try to cut him off. Lee KICKS one of them into the pool. He faces off with the other two as more agents come across the yard. Lee swings and kicks his way around the pool. Two more AGENTS get into the fray. Lee pops one into the other and pushes both of them into the pool. Suddenly the odds are too great as more agents close in. Lee DIVES into the pool and swims under water to the other end. He comes up in time to PUNCH two of the guys he threw in. Then he jumps out of the pool. Six agents chase him back across the lawn. Lee runs up an outside staircase at the back of the house. He disappears in a door just as one of the agents FIRES.
We HEAR the shot ring out.

sentences.line: Down stairs, sir! Now!
sentences.followup: Whitney shoves the Ambassador and Chi-Ying out of the bedroom. Then he charges out onto a balcony, gun drawn.

shots.desc: Lee comes down the hall, dripping wet. He moves quickly and quietly. He passes a doorway and immediately RUSS comes out the door, behind Lee, quietly getting ready to pounce. Ahead of Lee, Whitney comes out of the bedroom gun drawn. Suddenly, Lee takes out Russ behind him with an elbow and does his quick hands routine with Whitney's pistol. Both Whitney and Russ end up on their backs.

Han and His wife are surrounded by agents in the large open foyer below the staircase. Suddenly, Lee drops down from the stairway above and lands right in front of Han. SIX FBI PISTOLS all point at Lee.

sentences.line: Lee?
Sorry I'm late, sir.
sentences.followup: Lee bows, offers a smile of regret. Then he looks down at his feet where he's now dripping water. Russ and Lee appear on the landing above the foyer. Han looks up and sees them.

sentences.line: Mr. Russ, I think there has been a misunderstanding. Both Russ and Lee are looking embarrassed.
I would like you to meet, Mr. Lee. Lee looks up and bows to them both.
Excuse me very much.
sentences.followup: Agents slowly lower their guns. Lee holds up TWO REVOLVERS.

sentences.line: (to Russ and Whitney) Oh yes, your guns. Russ fumes.
Where the hell is --

shots.desc: Pulling up to the Consulate Compound. Holding out his I.D. and passing FBI AGENT WILLIS.

sentences.line: Good job, Detective. Real nice piece a work.
sentences.followup: Carter gives him a look. No idea what he's talking' about. But he must have done something good.

sentences.line: OK. Yeah. Thanks.

shots.desc: Carter enters, heads for the office when the door opens and Han and Lee come out. Carter stops, floored.

sentences.line: Hey! Lee smiles. Turns to the Ambassador.
This is the agent I was telling you about. Mr. Carter. Han looks at Carter. But Carter just stares at Lee.
I'm sure Mr. Carter was only concerned with my best interests. He did not understand the importance of my getting here quickly.
sentences.followup: Russ exits the office, staring at Carter. Carter realizes he's in some shit, unless he can do a little fast bullshitting. Carter suddenly smiles at Lee.

sentences.line: Sorry I'm late. Guess the directions were okay. Carter looks at Lee's wet clothes.
I see you came via Malibu.
(to Lee) Come on. Let's get you some dry clothes.
Carter, can I have a moment? Of course, sir. All the time you want.
sentences.followup: Carter smiles at Lee as he moves past and enters the Lion's den. The door closes.

shots.desc: Russ faces off with Carter.

sentences.line: What do you mean you lost him?! How could you lose him?!
Try a bus load of - no, make that two bus loads of Chinese -- The PHONE RINGS. Russ turns to the phone.
You want me to take care of this, you gotta use me.
sentences.followup: Russ ignores him. Han enters, moving quickly to the desk.

sentences.line: You understand what I'm sayin'?
Carter, shut up!
sentences.followup: Lee steps into the room. All attention on Han. Russ nods to him. Han answers. The ELECTRONIC SURVEILLANCE EQUIPMENT CLICKS INTO ACTION - recording, tracking. The phone conversation is in Mandarin.

sentences.line: Hello.
Ambassador Han.
Yes.
Even if you deny the FBI is there, I will assume you are lying. Han looks at Russ. Russ hesitates, then nods.
My daughter.
She's fine.
Can I speak with her? Sang speaks on the phone, seated at an empty table .
Not yet.
sentences.followup: Sang looks at his watch, in no hurry.

key_words: ELECTRONIC SURVEILLANCE EQUIPMENT CLICKS INTO ACTION

shots.desc: Whitney is watching the clock. They need a few more moments to make the trace.

sentences.line: (whisper) Keep him talking. Phone conversation continues in Mandarin.
How do I know she is alive?
Have to take my word for it.
What do you want?
I want you to think for a moment... what is a daughter worth?
sentences.followup: Whitney motions to keep talking. They're close. Very close to making the trace.

sentences.line: Everything.
Good. I'd hate to think less. Whitney signals. They've got the trace.
But we've talked enough for now. I'll call later, after you've had a chance to think about... the mistakes you've made. The phone line goes dead. Whitney holds up the paper.
620 South Main. Downtown.
sentences.followup: Russ, Whitney and Agents immediately head for the door, past Lee and Carter.

shots.desc: Russ, Whitney, other Agents exit, moving to cars. Lee hurries up

sentences.line: Mr. Russ -- Russ stops, turns to Lee.
Mr. Lee, Detective Carter has been assigned to help you. He is the very best at... (pause) ...what he does. Excuse me.
sentences.followup: A car pulls up. Russ gets in. Car pulls away. Followed by others. Lee watches, anger building, but trying not to show it. Carter comes up behind him. Both of them watch the FBI cars peel out. Then they turn and look at each other. Not exactly a match made in heaven.

shots.desc: THREE UNMARKED FBI CARS pull out of the Consulate Compound. Move quickly down the street. Carter's sedan pulls out a few moments later.
Carter behind the wheel. Lee next to him. Both are quiet for a moment, then --

sentences.line: You're a regular god damn acrobat, aren't you? Bet you feel real good makin' me look like an asshole.
It was not my intent --
Right....
Mr. Carter, I appreciate your desire to show me a good time, but that is not the reason I am here.
Let me just clarify a few things. I don't care what kind of cop you are in China, you have no jurisdiction in America. Without me you are just another tourist. Carter and Lee exchange a look.
So don't pull that shit again. they're following.
What about them?
I know a shortcut.
Shortcut?
You don't know what a shortcut is? Lee shakes his head.
(to himself) Lame ass country.

shots.desc: Carter is repeatedly hitting the speed dial on his CELL PHONE while he drives. We hear that HEE HAW sound you get when you're in cell phone hell.

sentences.line: (tossing the phone) Piece a shit.
sentences.followup: Carter starts looking for a phone booth. Lee, meanwhile, picks up the cell phone and expertly RIPS it open. He starts studying the inner workings of the phone.

sentences.line: Accessory board probably burnt out. Carter looks over at his phone and freaks.
Hey! What did you do to my phone, man!? You people can't keep your hands off electronics, can you?!

shots.desc: He pulls across the street from a MINI-MART. We see EMPTY PHONE BOOTHS out front.

sentences.line: Wait here.
sentences.followup: Carter shuts the door. Starts away. Stops. Then returns to the car, reaches in and quickly snaps a hand cuff on Lee's arm and another on the steering wheel.

sentences.line: Always cuff a friend or a wife or a kid to the steering' wheel so nobody'll steal the car. It's like a human anti-theft device. (big smile) Be right back.
sentences.followup: Carter crosses to the Mini Mart. Lee watches him, then looks at his wrist cuffed to the steering wheel.

shots.desc: Carter is HOLDING on the pay phone when a GUY IN A TURBAN comes out of the store.

sentences.line: Nice hat. (on the phone) Hey, Johnson! It's Carter. Listen, meet me at 620 S. Main. Some Federal type action is gonna be going down there. INTERCUT WITH JOHNSON She's at her desk.
Well.. I wouldn't want to be in the way.
No way in the way! I'm talkin' back up, Johnson. I'm in charge! And I need you, baby.

shots.desc: Carter comes back across the street and gets in the car.

sentences.line: OK, now I'm gonna show you what a shortcut is...
sentences.followup: Carter reaches down to start the car and finds that his steering wheel is gone. Along with Lee.

sentences.line: Sonuvabitch!

shots.desc: UNMARKED CARS pulling up. FBI SPECIAL TACTICS TEAMS arriving and deploying. The target: the OLD OFFICE BUILDING across the street. A TEAM OF BLACK CLAD FBI moves into the ground floor. he's still attached to it. Whitney sees him first and does a double take.

sentences.line: Jesus H... Lee moves toward Whitney.
Where's Carter?
Lost I think. Which building? Russ walks up.
Mr. Lee, this is an FBI operation.
I was brought here to help.
Please stay back. Two AGENTS walk up ready to restrain him.
She is very important to me. You must let me --
Mr. Lee, the very fact that you know her compromises your judgement. Whitney comes up behind Russ, interrupting --
Area secured. Teams ready.
sentences.followup: Another TAXI pulls up. Carter jumps out. Storming toward Lee.

sentences.line: He stole my wheel!
This is pathetic.
I'm gonna arrest the sonuvabitch! (turns to Lee) Your ass is goin' to jail! Carter WHISPERS to the two restraining agents:
Hold me back. (yelling) After I kick it first!
(to OTHER AGENTS) Get them the hell out of here! (on the radio) You are cleared to go.

shots.desc: We can see FLASHLIGHTS moving in the windows as the team moves to the top floor.

The DOOR is KICKED OPEN. AGENTS BURST INTO THE ROOM, Drop to positions, ready to fire. They move quickly through the office, checking every corner. But the office is empty. Except for the table, chair and phone.

sentences.line: (into radio) Area secured. The room is empty. INTERCUT WITH RUSS ON THE STREET as he gets the message.
Dammit!
A table, chair and phone.
sentences.followup: THE PHONE RINGS. The Lead Agent turns to the phone. First ring, second ring.

sentences.line: And it's ringing. (Third ring) What do you want me to do? Russ hesitates. Then starts running for the building.
I'm on my way.
sentences.followup: FOURTH RING. FIFTH RING. Finally he takes off his helmet, picks up the receiver.

key_words: INTERCUT WITH RUSS ON THE STREET

shots.desc: The TOP FLOOR OF THE BUILDING SUDDENLY BLOWS UP in a huge fireball. Russ and Agents are knocked down. Lee and Carter take cover from the debris. CLOUD OF DUST AND SMOKE roll over them. When Lee gets up, he's facing away from the building. He sees something. P.O.V. OF A MAN -- CONTINUOUS Standing in a doorway as the FLASH FROM THE EXPLOSION LIGHTS up his
key_words: TOP FLOOR OF THE BUILDING SUDDENLY BLOWS UP

shots.desc: Lee is stunned. He gets up quickly, starts running after Sang who disappears down an alley into darkness. Carter sees Lee.

sentences.line: Hey! (to himself) Not this time...
sentences.followup: Carter goes after him.

shots.desc: Lee runs after Sang into the alley.

Sang is running hard when he turns and sees Lee. Sang jumps onto a DUMPSTER in the alley, grabs a FIRE ESCAPE LADDER and starts climbing. Lee leaps onto the dumpster, grabs the ladder and goes up. Sang climbs two stories, smashes a WINDOW and climbs into the building.
He rounds the corner and sees Lee going up the building.

sentences.line: What are you doing, god damn it!?
sentences.followup: Carter runs for the dumpster and the fire escape.

shots.desc: We're in an ABANDONED ATRIUM moving down an open, dirty hallway. Lee moves quickly and quietly. He peaks over the edge of the atrium: LEE'S POV Two floors below we see a TUNNEL filled with trash. Lee passes SCAFFOLDING that's been abandoned. He stops and listens. Suddenly, we hear SOMEONE RUNNING. Lee takes off.
He climbs through the window and takes off down the open hallway.

He explodes around a corner and runs over a BRIDGE connecting both sides of the atrium. A sign on the bridge says DANGER-UNDER CONSTRUCTION. The bridge CREAKS and moves. Sang STUMBLES and drops something. But Sang doesn't stop and he makes it over the bridge. Lee runs up right behind Sang but he slows when he sees the bridge and the sign. He starts over slowly and picks up WHAT SANG DROPPED. CLOSE ON A DETONATOR The bridge CREAKS Loudly. But Lee scampers across. Carter is right on his heels. He doesn't even see the sign and accelerates as he runs over the bridge. We hear a massive CRACK!

sentences.line: Oh shiiiiit!
sentences.followup: The bridge gives way and Carter drops like a brick. He falls two stories and hits the tunnel floor on top of a huge mass of debris. Dust swirls for a moment. Carter doesn't move and then:

sentences.line: ...ahhh.

shots.desc: He's across the atrium when he sees Carter fall. Lee grabs a PIPE and quickly swings himself down to the floor of the tunnel. He finds Carter covered in dust and debris.

sentences.line: Am I dead?
sentences.followup: Suddenly we HEAR SCREECHING TIRES. Both men turn. A CAR IS SCREAMING DOWN THE TUNNEL toward them. Lee looks around. No where to go. At the last instant, he grabs Carter and they roll out of the way. The car ROARS by and goes out the other end of the tunnel.

sentences.line: You make the plate?
What plate?
The license! You get it?!
No.
LEE Did you make the plate?!
It was my ass that almost got trashed!
He was trying to kill me, not you.
Yeah, sure, you got lots a enemies in L.A. after what? Six hours?
It was a man I was after in Hong Kong.
Bullshit! You were trying' to lose my ass again.
I might have... (pause) It does not matter now. Lee starts walking down the tunnel.
Hey, wait a second! Lee keeps walking.

You tryin' to make this out to be my fault? Like it was me who got in the way of you?! You gotta not be serious. (nothing from Lee) That what you're thinking'?! Come on, say it if you think it. SAY IT! Lee stops, turns back.
When a man steps in dung, it is obvious. There is no need to rub it in his face. The smell is the same.
What is that, some kind of Chinese proverb?
No. I just made it up.

shots.desc: building. Russ and Whitney stand grimly watching the carnage. JOHNSON walks up to them.

sentences.line: (to Russ) Excuse me. I'm looking for Detective Carter...
Who are you? Johnson pulls her badge.
LAPD. Explosives Division. Russ suddenly gets angry.
Did Carter send for you?
Yes sir.
Explosives Division?! Well, you're too god damn late! Lee and Carter walk up.
Yo, Johnson...
(interrupting) You think this is funny, Carter? You send for someone from Explosives!? Four men just died in there!
Hey, man, you can use her. She's an expert!
That's what you were supposed to be! Johnson is starting to back away.
Look, I don't know what's goin' on here, but I'm history. She starts to walk back to her car.
No, wait!
sentences.followup: He runs after Johnson and catches her as she gets into her car. Hey, I don't need that. You just got your last back-up from me. She squeals away from the scene. Carter looks beat up and defeated. We HEAR a PHONE START TO RING. Once, twice. Carter turns. A PAY PHONE is ringing next to a building. Three, four, five. Carter, annoyed, finally crosses to the booth, answers --

sentences.line: You're calling a phone booth, asshole.
sentences.followup: Hangs up. He gets five steps away when it starts to RING AGAIN. He stops, turns back. Answers.

sentences.line: You know what a phone booth is?!
The bomb was meant as a demonstration of our sincerity. If you want the Ambassador's daughter back alive, listen and do not talk.
sentences.followup: Carter realizes now who he's got on the other end of the line. He covers the receiver.

sentences.line: Lee! It's him!
The first drop will be made tomorrow. At twelve o'clock. The amount will be fifty million.
Fifty million! Are we talkin' United States dollars?
In used currency. Nothing bigger than a fifty.
That's some serious poundage in dollars.
sentences.followup: Carter covers the phone and tries to get the attention of the FBI.

sentences.line: Hey, it's him. On the phone. (back to phone) Where do you think an Ambassador's gonna come up with that kinda cash? I mean, how much can a guy like that take home, after taxes? And in China. (covers phone again) Lee finally turns and hears him.
(back to phone) I mean I don't think he even gets paid in dollars. They probably pay in yang or yin or...rice, whatever it is they got there. Lee walks over. Carter holds the phone so Lee can hear.
What is your name?
That's cool. We're gettin' to know each other. This is a good thing. I'm Carter.
Carter. I just want to be able to tell the Ambassador who was responsible for the death of his daughter because he talked too much.
Hey, that's whacked! I thought we was gettin' on here!
Shut up!
OK. Say what it is.
The Ambassador will receive instructions for the drop, half an hour before it is to be made. If it is successful, there will be more. Thank you, Agent Carter.
sentences.followup: The phone goes dead. Carter exchanges a look with Lee.

shots.desc: Russ is on his car phone --

sentences.line: (into phone) -- as soon as we get a team in place...yes, sir. I'll make sure it happens. Russ hangs up as Carter approaches.
Fifty million --
I don't think you need to be here!
sentences.followup: Russ turns away. Whitney gives Carter a look, then follows.

sentences.line: That's what the man wants for the girl. Just called on the pay phone across the street. With the instructions for the first drop. Just thought you might be interested. It's what they call a ransom demand. Carter turns and starts walking away.
Carter! Carter turns slowly.
Hmmmm?
Don't play bullshit games with me.
Eleven thirty tomorrow the Ambassador will receive a phone call telling him where the drop is. He said the bomb was a demonstration of their sincerity. Carter turns to go, then stops, turns back.
Oh yeah. The caller was a man. Confident. Had an accent. My guess, Asian. Anything else I can do for the FBI, sir?
Why don't you try the assignment. Or should I call and ask for somebody who can handle it?
No, sir. I'm as good as it gets.
sentences.followup: Carter offers a smile, then starts back toward Lee. The smile disappears as he turns his back on Russ.

sentences.line: (to himself) Prick.

shots.desc: We watch Carter and Lee get out of a cab in the Los Felis district. Over this we HEAR:

sentences.line: I thought you said you'd never been to America before. How the hell did you know where you were goin' if you never been here before? Huh?
(pissed off) You had map in car. Chinese can read maps, too. Where will you take me now, Disneyland?
Hey, I was just doin' my job. (pause) We're goin' to my crib.
Crib? What crib?
My home, man, my home!

shots.desc: Carter and Lee come through the door into a dark leather living room set up for one thing: pussy. Carter hits a series of switches. Subdued lights come on, a stereo starts with nasty rap, a gas fireplace pops on, and SOFT PORN starts playing on the VCR. Carter sees Lee's reaction to the setting.

sentences.line: I can't help it. I'm a hopeless romantic.
sentences.followup: Carter disappears into a bedroom. Lee wanders over to a shelf with a collection of LOVE OILS. Carter sticks his head out of the bedroom as he slips on a clean shirt.

sentences.line: Hey, don't drop that shit. It's imported. He goes back in the bedroom and talks from there.
Look, none of this has gone down right. Too many big heads thinkin' they don't need nothin' from nobody. Forgettin' a man's daughter is gone. He comes back out buttoning up a clean pair of pants.
I know I been part of it so... I'm sorry. Lee looks at Carter for a beat.
I worked with Ambassador Han and his family for ten years. He wanted me to come with them to America. If I had, this might not have happened.
Don't go there...
I could not come. I had other responsibilities.
Hey, stop. We're just gonna wind up in some bar, drinking' to forget all the things we shoulda done and then you'll start singin' Beach Boy songs again. Then I'll really get depressed.
I also did not come because I think I would not fit in America.

Hey, everybody fits in here. Look at L.A., man. Nobody's from here. My momma's from Detroit, my dad's from Atlanta, they met in Texas, got married in Vegas and I was born in Alabama. So where the hell am I from? Kenya? Carter looks at Lee and makes a decision.
Alright, listen, no bullshit just tell me straight: did you really know the guy you were chasin'?
Yes. He was part of the Juntao crime family. He may be Juntao himself. (reaches into pocket) And he dropped this.
sentences.followup: Lee retrieves a small BLACK CYLINDER. Carter glances at it. Then recognizes the DETONATOR.

sentences.line: Looks like a clue to me, Detective Lee. Carter smiles at Lee. Lee slowly smiles back at Carter.
Let's go see a friend of mine.

shots.desc: Lee and Carter come out a back door. Carter points below them on the street where a HUGE 1971 WHITE ELDORADO CONVERTIBLE sits gleaming under the street lights.

sentences.line: (proudly) The Carter ride. Lee takes in the car as they walk up to it.
(in awe) This is bigger than my apartment in Hong Kong. They get in.
Welcome to the wide open spaces of America!

shots.desc: It PURRS away from the curb and FLOATS down the road.
The Caddy pulls up to a pool hall in a semi sleazy area.

sentences.line: When we go inside, you let me handle everything, you hear? This is my man, you dig? My informant. You know what an informant is?
Stooly.
What?
Stool pigeon.

Yeah, somethin' like that. (talking very fast) OK, now this is a nasty ass place. When you go into a place like this, You got to maintain control. You following me? You lose it, you get hurt. Now, you're my responsibility and I don't want you hurt. You understand? OK, let's go.
sentences.followup: Carter gets out of the car and walks away. Lee doesn't move. After a beat, Carter comes back.

sentences.line: What?
You talk too fast.
Come on!

shots.desc: The boys walk into a smoky hall patronized mostly by black people. Carter leads Lee past pool tables as they work their way to the very back of the room. Carter makes his presence known as he walks.

scenes.place: He passes a guy taking a hit off a JOINT. He stops.

shots.desc: CARTER (to the guy) That better not be what I think it is. Gimme that. Carter swipes the joint out of the guy's hand. He takes a big hit. He holds it and tastes it for a beat. Lee is looking at Carter in disbelief.

sentences.line: Wait a minute. He takes ANOTHER HIT. Gives the joint back.
Don't leave town. I'm watching you.
sentences.followup: Carter keeps moving. He walks by a luscious looking girl with tight stuff on.

sentences.line: You see my ride, baby? You'd look good in that. Go outside. Take a look. He walks by a guy who gives him a dirty look.
What are you lookin' at, dickhead? three more wait and four nasty looking BITCHES watch the action.
sentences.followup: One of the players looks nervous when he sees Carter. This is OSCAR.

sentences.line: What's up, man?
Let's take a walk, Oscar. You got something a mine. (to Lee) Stay here.
sentences.followup: Carter takes Oscar's arm and starts moving him out the side door. Two BIG BLACK DUDES in the foursome start to move to Oscar's aid. But he holds up his hands.

sentences.line: It's cool.
sentences.followup: Oscar and Carter go out the back door. Lee sits down against the wall. One of the nasty bitches watching the game is ASIAN. She gives Lee a little smile. He smiles back. One of the BIG BLACK DUDES notices.

shots.desc: Carter and Oscar are arguing.

sentences.line: ...never, never come here! I told you that, god damn it! And who the hell is that little gook you brought with you!
Shut up, Oscar! I don't take shit from you! I give out the shit. That is the basis of our relationship. I give you shit and you take it!

shots.desc: We're on the POV of one of the BIG BLACK DUDES who is lining up a shot. RACK FOCUS to Lee's face who is in perfect line for the shot.

sentences.line: (still lining up) What are you smiling at, rice bowl?
Who, me?
You making slant eyes at my girl friend? himself and forces a frown.
sentences.followup: WHACK! Big dude hits the object ball so hard, it hops the table and heads right for Lee's head. Lee catches it like a baseball line drive, right in front of his nose. Nobody moves for a beat, mainly because everyone is impressed with Lee's catch.

sentences.line: My friend does not want me to get hurt.
sentences.followup: Big Dude WHIPS the cue stick like a bat at Lee's head. Lee ducks and it SHATTERS against his chair. BIG DUDE #2 lunges for Lee who BOPS him with the pool ball he caught. And they're off! Two other guys jump on Lee and start pounding the shit out of em. Lee flips one onto the table and elbows the other. The two Big Dudes grab fresh cues.

shots.desc: Oscar is turning the detonator over in his hand.

sentences.line: I ain't the man to be telling you about this.
Then who is?
Shit, you already busted his ass. Lafontaine. The dude who blew up the diner. He's your leverage. (holding up the detonator) He knows where this shit come from.

shots.desc: WHAM! Lee is thrown against the back wall. The nasty girls all run past him and retreat to the ladies room. Lee grabs a cue and comes out swinging. He backs three guys away and then stops. BIG DUDE #1 is swinging his own cue. Lee paries like a fencer. He puts one hand behind his back and continues to parry and thrust. Finally, he pokes Big Dude in the forehead with his tip leaving a blue chalk spot. Then he turns the cue around and belts the guy on the spot. Lee turns and BREAKS his cue over two guys simultaneously, ducks a cue shot to his own head, and kicks one guy over a table and drops another with a flurry of hands. emptied. The guys he fought are all knocked out and UNDER tables. Carter comes in the back door.

sentences.line: (to Lee) Let's go. (he looks around) Everybody take off?
Took off. Yes. They took off. Lee catches up with Carter.
You see what I'm sayin'? You control the space.
Thank you. I learn a great deal.
It happens.
sentences.followup: Carter spots one of the fighters ON THE FLOOR as they walk out. It's the same guy who was smoking the joint. The guy moans as they go past.

sentences.line: (to the doper/fighter) Hey, lightweight, I told you to lay off that shit. (over his shoulder) Get an education!

shots.desc: ESTABLISHING the PRISON. The Cadillac SCREECHES to a stop.
Carter is talking to the OFFICER (BOBBY) behind the GLASS BOOTH.

sentences.line: It's eleven o'clock at night, Carter! They're all locked down, lights out.
Yeah, but they're criminals, Bobby. Who gives a shit if they lose some sleep? Come on: wake his ass up.
sentences.followup: BOBBY shakes his head but he picks up the phone.

shots.desc: Lee and Carter are waiting. Door opens. Bobby leads Lafontaine into the room. Lafontaine is pissed off, especially when he sees Carter.

sentences.line: I got nothing to say to you. Carter motions for the guard to exit.
Give us five minutes, Bobby. The guard departs.
Sit down.
sentences.followup: Lafontaine sits. Carter puts the detonator on the table. Pushes it across to him. Lafontaine picks it up, looks at Carter with a sick smile and PRESSES THE BUTTON.

sentences.line: Boom.
sentences.followup: Lafontaine shoves the detonator back at Carter. Carter picks it up with a HANDKERCHIEF.

sentences.line: You got a boy friend in here yet? Cause you're gonna need somebody to kiss your ass goodbye.
What are you talking about?

You're movin' to death row. See, your fingerprints are now on the murder weapon of Four FBI Agents. And when I turn this into the lab, they're gonna find Lafontaine all over it. And we already know... (holding up detonator) ...this is your MO.
How did I do this?! Maybe you didn't notice but I'm in jail!

All I gotta do is implicate. The Feds can do a lot with a good implication. Even if you don't get Sparky, I'll bet you get ten to twenty more. Plenty of time to find a nice fella. Lafontaine looks at Carter and Lee for a moment, then --
You sonuvabitch.
I'm waitin' here for a name.
sentences.followup: Lee following.

sentences.line: I've never seen him. Carter ignores him. Starts to knock for the Guard.
Juntao. Carter and Lee exchange glances.
Where do we find him?
You don't. He finds you. Through his people. Carter and Lee wait for more.
(quietly) Fang Shan. A restaurant. China Town.

shots.desc: The FBI cars are parked in front. Lights burning in Han's office. ARMED GUARDS now in front.
Han has just received the news from Russ. The mood in the room is grim.

sentences.line: I am so sorry about your men.
Yes sir, me too. The State Department has authorized release of the funds. We'll have to make the first drop at 7. As soon as they pick up the money, we've got em.
And Mr. Lee? Where is he?
Don't worry, he's with Carter.

shots.desc: Lee is explaining as Carter drives.

sentences.line: Juntao was one of the worst crime bosses in Hong Kong. When China regained control, he was forced out. Carter flips his cell phone open.
Let's get us a photo and description. We'll have an APB out while we stake out the restaurant.
That is a problem. There is no description of Juntao. No known photograph.
Are you tellin' me nobody knows what he looks like? Come on, there must be witnesses somewhere.
Juntao's standing orders were to kill everyone. There were never witnesses.

shots.desc: The architecture. The signs. It's a different world. The Cadillac cruises down the street. It's late. Most things are closed.
The Cadillac is parked on the side street.
Carter and Lee are watching Fang Shan restaurant, eating from cartons of Chinese food.

sentences.line: You like it?
Yeah, it's good.
That one is my favorite. Chicken puff with shark fin. Carter starts chewing a little slower.
And the Eel is very good, too. But I have had better Camel's Hump. Carter has trouble swallowing. Puts down his food.
You want more?
hump, you know, gives me gas. (belches) scuse me. Silence for a moment, then Lee motions to the radio.
Music? A beat, then Carter nods. Lee reaches for the radio.
No! This time I pick.
sentences.followup: Carter turns on the radio. Dials around until he finds WAR.

sentences.line: Now, that's American music.
Yes, I know this song.
You know War?
Who does not know War? (starts) War, hhh, Wo-ooh-wo-ooh-wo-oh. What is it good for? Absolutely nothing. Good-God, you all. Carter just stares at Lee for a moment in disbelief.
That's not how it goes.
Yes, I think so.
No, no. It's not good-God you all! It's Good-God, ya'll. Ya'll!
Yee-aww. Carter turns off the radio.
Not yee-aw, Ya'll. And it's gotta be angry. Like you're pissed off.
Good God, ya'll!
No! You hate me. Look, I'm gonna do it one time. That's it.
sentences.followup: Carter gets out of the car. Lee follows. Carter limbers up for a moment, then starts a dance move to get him into the beat.

sentences.line: War! huuuuhh! wo-ooh-wo-ooh-wo-oh! what's it good for? absolutely nuthin' good-gawd ya'll!
sentences.followup: Lee gives it his best shot, trying to mimic Carter's dance move. But it's more martial arts than dance.

sentences.line: War! huuuuhh! wo-ooh-wo-ooh-wo-oh! what's it good for? absolutely nuthin' good-gawd ya'll
sentences.followup: Lee tries to get into the rhythm with Carter, undulating his body to Carter's motion. But Carter watches Lee's martial arts interpretation and he starts to alter his moves to Lee.

sentences.line: War! huuuuhh! wo-ooh-wo-ooh-wo-oh! what's it good for? absolutely nuthin' good-gawd ya'll!
sentences.followup: Both of them are moving side by side, in step as they sing. Totally involved. Rocking out.

sentences.line: War! huuuuhh! wo-ooh-wo-ooh-wo-oh! what's it good for? absolutely nuthin' good-gawd ya'll!
sentences.followup: They both turn and face each other. As they dance, Lee BEGINS TO TEACH CARTER his quick move for taking someone's gun away.

shots.desc: A FEW NIGHT PEOPLE have stopped to listen. Staring at the Cadillac parked on the street. With Carter singing at the top of his lungs and Lee teaching him the quick moves to the music.
