sentences.line: War! huuuuhh! wo-ooh-wo-ooh-wo-oh! what's it good for? absolutely nuthin' good-gawd ya'll!

shots.desc: SAME SHOT FADES to the next morning.
Lee and Carter are asleep in the car. Carter's head is slumped against the window. A BUS ROARS past. They wake up. Carter groans.

sentences.line: CARTER I got to stop that dancing in the street till all hours.
sentences.followup: Carter stretches as Lee hops out HUMMING WAR, and opens the door for Carter.

shots.desc: THREE CARS pull up in front of the bank. Ambassador Han gets out of one. Followed by Russ, Whitney, and others. Security is high.
Carter and Lee are at a table. Carter is having coffee. Lee is eating breakfast - rice and fish - with chopsticks. All the patrons are Asian. Carter is staring at Lee's food. Lee notices.

sentences.line: Want some?
No, fish is a PM food.
Excuse me?
Nobody in America eats fish in the AM. We're talking strictly an after twelve noon food type.
sentences.followup: Lee turns and looks out the window. LEE'S P.O.V. He sees Sang entering the Fang Shan restaurant. BACK AT THE TABLE Lee stands suddenly.

sentences.line: What?!
It's him.
sentences.followup: Carter looks out the window. But the street is already full of ASIAN PEOPLE.

sentences.line: Which one?
Carter throws some money onto the table.

shots.desc: Carter and Lee exit the restaurant, moving down the street.

sentences.line: This is my territory now. You are my responsibility.
(pointing down) This concrete? This is still America.
What do you hear?
sentences.followup: They listen. CHINESE MUSIC filters out from one of the shops. SEVERAL CONVERSATIONS are in Chinese. There is nothing that would suggest this is America.

sentences.line: Walk two more blocks and neither of us will understand the language. Look, we can't take a chance on him recognizing you. Especially if he's Juntao. I'll go in, you back me up. That's the way it's gonna be.

shots.desc: In a private room, TEN MILLION DOLLARS is running though a money counting machine. Ambassador Han watches with Russ, Whitney and SEVERAL ASIAN BANK OFFICIALS.

The Asian man who drove the van (Chung) lifts the top of a DUMPSTER, throws a BLACK GARBAGE BAG inside. FROM UNDERNEATH THE DUMPSTER A sewer grate is REMOVED. Shu, one of the other men involved in the kidnapping, reaches up, opens a hidden door in the bottom of the Dumpster and pulls out the black trash bag. He drops down into the sewer. The sewer grate comes down on top as if nothing is out of place.
A trap door opens and Shu crawls into the room. SEVERAL ASIAN MEN are waiting for him. Among them, Sang. Shu holds up the black garbage bag. Sang nods.
Open for business. Lee and Carter cross the street.

sentences.line: OK, when you go in, just act like you're from outa town.
I am from outa town.
No, like a tourist. You know, things to see, money to burn, interested in stupid shit.
Ah. Like this. Lee looks around a lot and smiles.
Yeah, yeah, good. You're havin' fun. Lookin' for a good time. You know, watch the women, look at their legs and shit. Like that's all you can think about. Gettin' some. Like her.
sentences.followup: Carter motions at AN ATTRACTIVE ASIAN WOMAN moving toward them. Lee watches her walk past. He smiles politely. Carter watches him for a beat, then --

sentences.line: That ain't gonna get it. Watch this.
sentences.followup: Carter screws up his face as if he's really enjoying watching the woman - like she's the best thing he's ever seen. A complete politically incorrect slob of a man. The only thing missing is the drool.

sentences.line: Like that.
I am sorry, but I have too much respect for women.
sentences.followup: Carter stares at him blankly, then puts an arm around him.

sentences.line: This is nothin' personal with women. We are undercover. It's okay to be a player when you're undercover. Okay? Lee hesitates, then nods. Carter takes out his i.d.
You've got no jurisdiction here so I'm some shit, you're L.A.P.D.
sentences.followup: Carter opens his i.d. - Carter is black, Lee is Asian - that's one difference.

sentences.line: Hold it like this, flip it open, flip it closed. It's the attitude that says who you are, not the i.d.
sentences.followup: Carter flips the i.d. with authority, partially covering his photo with his hand. We hardly even see the photo. Carter hands the i.d. back to Lee.

sentences.line: You got to make people think this is you. (re: Carter's photo) You gotta believe that face is your face. Lee tries the flip.
More wrist. It's gotta snap. Can't be limp. You do limp, they look at the photo, we're dead.
sentences.followup: Carter points to his face. Lee tries the flip with more wrist. Snapping it open.

sentences.line: Good. Gimme a couple minutes, then come in. And take this. Carter slips Lee his gun.
No, please, I don't --
It ain't your ass, it's my ass you're backin' up. Take the damn gun.
sentences.followup: Lee hesitates, then takes the gun and puts it into his pocket.

shots.desc: Carter enters the restaurant. Moves to the HOSTESS, a pretty young Chinese woman.

sentences.line: For one?
No. Two. Tell Juntao I'll buy him some eel and shark fin for lunch. I'm sorry, sir, but I don't know -- Carter puts on his best Johnny Cochran.

Tell Mister Juntao Johnny Cochran's little brother...Joey is here. Joey Cochran. I am the legal advisor of record for Mister Henry Lafontaine. I need to discuss some legal ramifications with him. Carter takes the menu from her.
I'll seat myself. I like that dress you're wearin'. Silk, right?
sentences.followup: Carter smiles, moves to a table. Leaving the Hostess staring at him.

shots.desc: An open suitcase is filled with stacks of U.S. CURRENCY. The suitcase is shut. Han is in the room with Russ, Whitney, and other agents. It's almost eleven thirty. Whitney is explaining an electronic device to Han.

sentences.line: ... one will be inserted into the suitcase, the other will be on you. After you make the drop -- The phone rings. Han picks up.
Yes.
You have what I asked for?
I do.
Pack it into black garbage bags. Throw the bags into a garbage dump in the alley behind the Fang Shan Restaurant in China Town. You have twenty-nine minutes left. The phone clicks dead. Russ stands.
Let's go.

scenes.time: INT. OFFICE FANG SHAN RESTAURANT CONTINUOUS

shots.desc: hangs up the phone. Back to us. A DOZEN MEN in the room, among them Sang and Chung. A knock. Sang opens the door. It's the HOSTESS. She whispers something to Sang. He then crosses to ANOTHER MAN at a desk.

sentences.line: Someone has asked for Juntao.
sentences.followup: The man turns now and we see it is Griffin.

shots.desc: moving into action. SPECIAL TACTICS TEAM loading up. Cars pulling out of the Chinese Consulate Compound. The AMBASSADOR'S JAGUAR leads the way. Russ in the seat next to him. Whitney in the back.

Six video monitors keep tabs on the restaurant. On one monitor, Carter is sitting at his table, studying a menu. He orders something from an ATTRACTIVE ASIAN WAITRESS. She moves away and Carter's eyes follow her figure. Griffin and Sang watch him.

sentences.line: Maybe I have seen him. I'm not sure.
Bring him up.
sentences.followup: Sang heads for the door when ANOTHER MONITOR catches Griffin's attention. The MONITOR reveals the Hostess seating a MAN at a table. It's Lee.

sentences.line: Wait!
sentences.followup: Sang turns at the door. Griffin is staring at the screen.

sentences.line: Get the girl.

shots.desc: PANEL VAN waiting. Back doors are open. Shu exits the restaurant, large sack (Soon Young inside) over his shoulder. He puts the sack into the Van.

Carter is at the urinal when he HEARS the VAN DOORS CLOSE from a partially open window. Then SOMEONE SPEAKING IN MANDARIN. Sounds urgent. He moves to the window, climbs up onto the sink. CARTER'S POV He can see SHU talking with the DRIVER OF THE VAN, Chung. Then another man exits the restaurant and we just get a glimpse of him before he gets into the van. It's Griffin. The only non-Asian Carter has seen in awhile. And the only British accent he's heard.

sentences.line: Make sure they do not leave.
sentences.followup: Griffin pulls the van door shut and the Van moves quickly down the alley. CALIFORNIA LICENSE - LIK.

shots.desc: He notes the LIK, until the bathroom door opens behind him. ANOTHER MAN enters, giving Carter a look as he's still on the sink, looking out the window. Carter takes a deep breath.

sentences.line: Ooo, man, what died! Whew! That wasn't me! Your own don't do that to you. AIR! Jesus....!
sentences.followup: Carter exits. Man gives him a look.

shots.desc: The attractive waitress pours a white powder into a pot of tea. She puts the pot onto her tray with a cup.

The restaurant is now full of PEOPLE eating lunch and ordering. Carter waits at the table. Sees Sang with two men behind him crossing toward him. Lee is sitting across the room. Half hidden behind a menu. He watches Sang approach Carter. The waitress delivers the tea to Lee. He smiles politely.

sentences.line: (in Mandarin) Have you decided yet?
sentences.followup: Lee, not wanting to take the menu down, shakes his head. The waitress departs. Lee's attention goes back to Carter. But he takes a sip of the tea. Sang stops at Carter's table.

sentences.line: Are you Juntao? Sang eyes him.
We have to talk. Or my client? He's gonna talk and save himself. Upstairs.
sentences.followup: Carter goes with Sang and the two men following. Lee waits until they are in the hallway, then he gets up and goes after them.

shots.desc: Lee sees the men take Carter up the stairway. TWO WAITERS come out of the kitchen. Lee enters the MENS ROOM.

Empty except for Lee. Lee waits, giving the waiters time to pass. Then reopens the door. Stairway clear. Lee moves quickly up the stairs. But stops partway up. Has to steady himself just for a second. He's definitely light headed.
Door opens. Sang enters, followed by Carter and two men.

sentences.line: Alright, if the shoe don't fit, you can't convict, you know what I'm sayin' here?
sentences.followup: WHACK! Sang spins and throws a FOOT into Carter's face. He slams to the floor.

sentences.line: (in Mandarin) Search him.
sentences.followup: The two men pick up a dazed Carter and Shu starts searching him.

shots.desc: Converging on Chinatown. Russ looks at his watch.

Lee moves up the stairs to the SECOND FLOOR. The door to the office is partially open. He sees CARTER GET SHOVED AGAINST a wall. Someone is coming out of the office. Lee quickly goes back down the stairs. Almost hits another waiter as he goes back into the MENS ROOM.
Lee waits. Thinks. He opens the door, sees another waiter moving past.

sentences.line: Excuse me.

shots.desc: A waiter moves up the stairs, tray of food held high. Not until he gets to the SECOND FLOOR and looks up from the tray do we see it's Lee. He moves to the office. Stops again. Bit of dizziness. But he's okay in a second.
Carter is shoved back against the wall again.

sentences.line: Hey, I'm a lawyer! You can't do this to a lawyer. You get in some deep shit for this kinda treatment.
sentences.followup: Carter watches as the men go through his wallet. Sang looks at his watch. Says something in Chinese to the men. Two of them move to Carter. They pick him up. Drag him to the door. A knock. Everyone stops. One of the men opens it. Tray of food. Sang turns away. Lee enters, glances at Carter. And Carter suddenly pulls his arms away from the men.

sentences.line: I'm tellin' you, when I sue, I win!
sentences.followup: Carter's outburst draws Sang's attention. And Lee takes advantage - swinging the tray of food at him. The metal tray smashes into Sang's head, food flying. The men charge Lee. Lee swings the tray, smacking the first two in the heads, blocking a punch from a third, then flinging it like a frisbee at Shu, catching him in the forehead.

sentences.line: (shocked) Damn, you're good!
sentences.followup: Carter gets immediately decked by two guys who run into the room.

sentences.line: L.A.P.D. Nobody move!
sentences.followup: Lee snaps open Carter's i.d. with so much attitude that it flies out of his hand, across the room. Hitting one of the men in the face.

sentences.line: Oh no...
sentences.followup: Carter gets up and turns on his two. Punching one in the gut, hitting the other in the chin.

sentences.line: Use the gun! USE THE GUN!
sentences.followup: Carter gets hit, goes down again. Lee pulls the gun just as one of the men hits him. The GUN is knocked from his hand, breaks THROUGH THE

shots.desc: The Ambassador's Jaguar pulls to the curb.
Russ checks his watch. Then picks up a radio.

sentences.line: (into radio) This is Agent Russ. We have five minutes. Take your positions.
sentences.followup: FBI CARS move past.

shots.desc: Each hitting an opponent - Lee a jab and elbow - Carter throws one to the gut, one to the jaw. Two different styles. Then they both get hit. And both slam back into the wall next to each other. Exchanging a quick look --

sentences.line: Where's my gun!
sentences.followup: Before Lee can answer, Sang wakes up and pulls a gun. Lee dives, rolls, comes up kicking. Hitting Sang's hand as he FIRES, sending THE GUN across the room as THE BULLET takes out a CHUNK OF WALL PLASTER right next to Carter's head.

shots.desc: The SOUND OF THE GUNSHOT stops everyone from eating. And all heads look up. MORE OF SANG'S MEN start for the stairs.

The office door crashes open and another man slams to the floor. Lee and Carter run out, right over the top of him. As GUN FIRE ERUPTS behind them, CHEWING UP THE WALL. Carter and Lee race down the stairs. Slamming into more WAITERS. SCREAMS from the dining room. PATRONS head for the door.

Lee and Carter burst in. Swinging doors hitting another waiter. His tray goes flying. He slams back into a chef who loses control of a pan of frying shrimp. The kitchen panics. Chefs and waiters try to get out of the way. Carter and Lee head for the back door. And then it really hits Lee. He staggers. Stops. Carter turns. Come on, let's go! Lee weaves as he tries not to fall.

sentences.line: What're you doin'?!
sentences.followup: The door slams opens behind them. Nailing the poor chef again. Lee spins around, falls back into Carter's arms.

sentences.line: No, no, don't do this! This is not the time!
sentences.followup: Carter pushes him up as the men charge into the kitchen. Lee takes a swing, but his hand accidentally hooks a pot of boiling Won Ton soup off the stove, flinging it back at the men as the charge in. They duck the shower of scalding broth. Then Carter starts grabbing every pot off the stove and flinging the hot food at the men. Lee joins in, throwing a barrage of hot chicken, fish, ribs, bok choi, chow mein, and fried rice at the men. Lee staggers to keep from falling. Then Lee grabs two WHOLE CATFISH on a cutting board as Carter starts throwing boxes of fortune cookies at the men. Lee attacks with the two fish. Hits one in the head, blocks a punch with another. The fish thud and SMACK with each blow. Lee swings the FISH together, slapping one man on both sides of his head. Two Catfish have never been more deadly. Another man comes up from behind, but Lee swings the Catfish under his legs and CATCHES THE MAN BEHIND HIM in the groin -CATFISH MOUTH WIDE OPEN. Then Lee spins around and slams his hands against the Catfish's mouth. The jaws clamp tight. The man SCREAMS and buckles. A fifth man dives at Lee, but he staggers, grabbing the man and shoving him headfirst into a ROW OF HANGING POTS. HEAD SMACKING into each one. A sixth man hits Carter from behind. Carter spins around, punches the man, knocking him into the hot stove, his hands going down ONTO THE HOT GRIDDLE. The man screams and turns quickly at Carter who nails him with a huge soup ladle. Lee turns, slipping, but kicking behind, catching another man and sending him crashing into a sink - pile of DIRTY DISHES CASCADING DOWN

shots.desc: . Lee swings wildly. Another man ducks, comes back up, pulling a gun, but Lee is still spinning uncontrollably and hits the man the second time around. The gun flies out of his hand and clanks onto the stove - open flame heating the metal.
a panic. And among them - Sang. He blends into the crowd and moves down the street.
Han, Russ, Whitney are watching.

sentences.line: Something's not right.
sentences.followup: Russ checks his watch.

shots.desc: Lee slips, grabbing hold of a refrigerator door to keep from falling. Pulling it open. Door slamming into the head of number seven, face first. Then Lee grabs a tray full of knives, slips backward, accidentally flinging them over his head, back at them. Everyone hits the floor as the KNIVES impale the wall. But one man manages to throw a bottle at Carter. Carter ducks and the bottle crashes into the stove. FLAMES ERUPT as the OIL falls onto the gas flames. The oil soaked wall BURSTS INTO FLAME. And the OVERHEATED BULLETS in the gun on the stove start to EXPLODE. Carter kicks open the back door as THE KITCHEN starts to FILL WITH BLACK OILY SMOKE.

Carter and Lee jump into the alley as the KITCHEN IGNITES. GAS MAIN BLOWING. WINDOWS SHATTER. FLAMES BLOW INTO THE ALLEY. Lee and Carter are knocked down. And they get up slowly. Both are covered in kitchen crap. Food, oil, dirt. Now, they move quickly down the alley. Then Carter sees his GUN on the ground. He picks it up.

sentences.line: Oh man, I don't even wanna know how it got out here!
sentences.followup: Lee staggers. Carter grabs him. A POLICE CAR roars up in front of them. POLICE are out, guns drawn, pointing at Carter and Lee.

sentences.line: Drop the gun!
I'm L.A.P.D.
CARTER (reaching for his pocket) I've got my i.d.
No!
sentences.followup: The police crouch, GUNS POINTED AT CARTER. Carter freezes, hand in pocket. Then Carter realizes he doesn't have it.

sentences.line: No, wait. I don't have it. (to Lee) You have it.
Oh yes.
sentences.followup: Lee, staggering, reaches for his pocket. The Police IMMEDIATELY TURN their guns on Lee.

sentences.line: Nobody move! But Lee suddenly realizes --
Oh no, I dropped it.
You drop my gun and you lose my i.d.?
I'm sorry.
You lent him your i.d.?
sentences.followup: Lee is completely leaning against Carter to keep from falling over. Carter hangs on, leaning back against him.

sentences.line: (angry) Yeah, I lent him my i.d. You got a problem with that?
No, I can see the resemblance. GET YOUR HANDS ON TOP OF YOUR HEADS!

key_words: YOUR HANDS ON TOP OF YOUR HEADS

shots.desc: THREE FEDERAL UNMARKED CARS screech to a stop in front. Doors open. Lee and Carter are escorted by a BEVY OF FBI AGENTS. Both Lee and Carter are still covered with the mess from the kitchen fight. Carter still partially carries Lee.

sentences.line: (to Lee) Don't worry. We're gonna make a full report. Bring these boys up to date.
sentences.followup: Carter looks confidently at the bureau boys surrounding him. They all look straight ahead, no expression, no comment.

shots.desc: Carter is split off from Lee by the AGENTS. Carter is lead into the office. Lee is escorted up the stairs.

sentences.line: Hey, wait a minute, he's with me.
Shut up.
sentences.followup: They push Carter into the office. Pulling the door shut. Lee is lead across the room.

shots.desc: Russ is seated behind the desk, on the phone.

sentences.line: ... yes, he's here. Uh-huh... Absolutely. Russ hangs up, stands to face Carter.
Okay, let me start from the top. A few days ago I was on this munitions dealer named Lafontaine. Now, after the shit blew up last night...
(interrupting) I'm not interested, Carter. You're no longer on this assignment.
What?!
And your buddy, Mr. Lee, is on his way back to China. Now, get out. Before I file obstruction of justice charges against you.
sentences.followup: Carter is stunned. TWO AGENTS open the door behind him. Carter hesitates. He's angry. But this is not the time or the place. He exits.

shots.desc: Han is pacing. Lee is leaning against a wall to keep from falling over. Ashamed. Conversation in MANDARIN.

sentences.line: I have disappointed you.
My disappointment is not what matters.
sentences.followup: Lee tries to take a step toward Han, but his knees start to get weak and he leans back against the wall. Han turns away from Lee. He can't stand to look at him in his condition.

sentences.line: I have no say in it now. I must rely upon the FBI to get Soon-Young back. They will escort you to the airport.
It was Juntao. Han turns.
Juntao?
sentences.followup: Lee nods. The door suddenly opens and Carter enters with TWO AGENTS trying to keep him from doing so. Carter pulls away from them.

sentences.line: Mr. Ambassador, I just want you to know that whatever you think Lee did, he didn't. It was my fault.
(to Han) Sorry, sir.
sentences.followup: Carter straightens out his dirty coat. Trying to find some dignity in his filthy appearance.

sentences.line: I never intended to risk your daughter's life... The PHONE RINGS. Russ and three agents enter quickly.
We've got a call. (to agents) Get them out!
sentences.followup: The Agents move to Lee and Carter. Escorting them out of the room. The door closes.

sentences.line: Okay, pick it up.
sentences.followup: Han picks up a phone at the same time Russ picks up a second phone.

sentences.line: (into phone) Yes.
You have run out of time. The amount now is two hundred million. I will call later with instructions. You will either deliver the money or pick up the body of your daughter.
Please, you must understand, what happened today was not --
Dad, are you okay?
(stunned) Soon Young!

shots.desc: Sang is holding the phone to Soon Young. The black mask has been pulled up so she can talk.

sentences.line: Please, do what they ask or they will kill me. BACK TO HAN
Soon Young, tell them I will do --
sentences.followup: The phone goes dead. End of conversation. Han looks at Russ, then turns away, trying to maintain his composure.

shots.desc: Lee and Carter are waiting outside the consulate. Agents flanking them. CARS are driving in through the gates.

sentences.line: I'm sorry, Lee.
Be sorry for Soon Young. She has no chance now.
sentences.followup: The first car pulls up. Agents opens the back door. Lee gets in. Car pulls away. Second car pulls up. It's Carter's Cadillac. Agent gets out, leaves the car running. Waits by the door. Nice job. Carter hands a DOLLAR to the Agent as he gets into the car. He tears out of the drive as the Agent crumples the bill and throws it after him.

shots.desc: Russ, Han, Whitney. Han is seated, head in hands. Whitney gets a call over his radio ear phone.

sentences.line: Excuse me, sir. Mr. Griffin has arrived.
sentences.followup: Han looks up. Russ nods to Whitney, who crosses to the door, opens it. Han's face brightens when he sees GRIFFIN. Griffin smiles. New hope has arrived.

sentences.line: I'm sorry, my friend. I could not sit back and do nothing.
sentences.followup: Griffin bows to Han.

shots.desc: A SEDAN moves past in traffic.
Evans is behind the wheel. Monroe next to him. Lee is in the back seat. He looks out the window at Los Angeles moving past. A SIGN READS: LAX. Lee is feeling very much alone.
He changes lanes as he follows Lee's car off the freeway. He dials his cell phone one handed.

sentences.line: (on the phone) Don't hang up. Please. INTERCUT With Johnson at home. She just got out of the SHOWER.
You got a lot of guts calling me.
you, Johnson. There's no one else I can trust.
You made a fool out of me! In front of the FBI!
Listen, this ain't about us! It's about a thirteen year old girl. She's not gonna make it. Unless we do something. That works on Johnson.
Jesus...what do you want?
This whole thing is goin' down tonight. I need to know where the Ambassador is gonna be. The Feds will be keepin' a lid on everything. You thing you can do that?
This is my city. I'm a cop. I'll find em.
Alright, Johnson, thank you. (pause) So...what are you wearing?
sentences.followup: CLICK.

shots.desc: Carter moves quickly through the terminal. Keeping his distance from Evans and Monroe as they escort Lee toward the gate.
Evans and Monroe exit the plane. Lee is sitting in First Class. Staring out the window. Completely depressed. Going home in disgrace.

Evans and Monroe turn from the window and start walking away from the gate. We stay with what WOULD HAVE BEEN their POV of the 747. After a beat, a FOOD CART rises up to the 747 door. Carter is leaning against the cart, enjoying the ride.
Everyone seated. Lee sits quietly. Lee looks up. Carter is standing at his seat. We HEAR the plane door close in preparation for taxi.

sentences.line: What are you doing here?
Well, I ain't goin' to China. (whispering) And neither are you.
sentences.followup: Carter moves up the aisle to a FLIGHT ATTENDANT. He takes a handkerchief out of his pocket and puts it over his face.

sentences.line: Excuse me. I'm declaring a medical emergency.
What? Are you sick?
No, no, not me. (points at Lee) My patient. Lee HEARS that he's the sick man.
I am Doctor...Dwight Gooden. Center for Disease Control. And I have to get him off this airplane. Now.
What's wrong with him?
sentences.followup: Lee looks at Carter. He'd like to know what's wrong with him too. Carter WHISPERS VERY LOUDLY so the whole first class compartment can hear.

sentences.line: He escaped from our clinic. He's got the Eboola...Moola virus. Very deadly. It's transmitted by the breath.
sentences.followup: A collective GASP goes up from the first class passengers.

sentences.line: Especially bad breath.
sentences.followup: Lee immediately starts MOANING. Carter suddenly goes into FAKE CHINESE, directed at Lee. Lee looks at him for a beat and then ANSWERS IN REAL MANDARIN. Oh God, we're in trouble. He's already started the chills... Lee starts SHAKING like he has a fever.

sentences.line: And diarrhea. Lee looks at him like, how am I supposed to do that?
I mean gas?
sentences.followup: Lee looks over at a middle aged woman, and COUGHS at her. The woman SCREAMS.

sentences.line: Open the door!
I can't open the door! We're ready to taxi.
Open the door now!
But I --
sentences.followup: Lee turns to a BANK PRESIDENT sitting next to him. He coughs at him. The guy SCREAMS and covers his face with his WALL STREET JOURNAL. Carter pulls Lee out of the seat.

sentences.line: Open the door, open the door! Carter goes into another burst of FAKE CHINESE. Lee HOWLS and MOANS.
Hurry! The projectile vomiting is about to begin!
sentences.followup: The Flight Attendant rushes to the door, opens it. And Lee runs for it, continuing to HOWL with Carter clinging to him.

shots.desc: Russ, Han, Whitney and other Agents. Griffin has the floor.

sentences.line: For fifteen years, Juntao has been the most powerful crime lord in southeast Asia, until the Chinese government regained control of Hong Kong. The his operation, but failed.
But why the Ambassador's daughter?

One of the last efforts between the British and the Chinese Governments was to raid every known asset of Juntao's operation. We confiscated over five hundred million dollars in weapons, drugs and a collection of Chinese art unsurpassed in the world.
But Juntao disappeared once again. Without witnesses.
Will he kill the girl?
I don't know. According to our informant, Juntao is seeking restitution. My advise is... pay the money.

shots.desc: The phone rings. Machines go into action. All FBI Agents in the room are looking tired, worn out by the ordeal. Han, now dressed in a tux, enters quickly, moving to the phone. Answers.

sentences.line: Hello.
Take the money with you tonight. Pack it in six dragons. You will be contacted again.
I want to speak with my daughter!
sentences.followup: The phone clicks dead.

shots.desc: The door opens revealing Johnson dressed in an elegant sequined evening gown. She looks gorgeous.

sentences.line: Oh my god...what happened to you?
CARTER It's called you're gonna kill me. What're you doin' with that on?
sentences.followup: Johnson crosses the room. Picks up TWO TUXEDOS hanging on a door.

sentences.line: The Ambassador is hosting the closing night of Chinese Expo at the Convention Center. It's black tie. Carter is trying not to look at Johnson's cleavage.
Well...OK. Good job. Johnson hands one tux to Carter, the other to Lee.
(to Lee) I'm Johnson. I had to guess at your size.
Thank you. You look very beautiful. Johnson smiles.
(to Lee) Hey, stop that. We're workin' here! I can't believe you be talkin' that shit. That's totally unprofessional!
sentences.followup: Carter grabs his tux and storms into the bathroom.

shots.desc: It lifts off from Van Nuys and swoops over our heads.
The PILOT is Asian. TWO MEN are in the back. We recognize them from the fight at the restaurant. They each carry automatic weapons.
Lee and Carter walk up to the Cadillac dressed in their tuxedos. Johnson stops dead when she sees the car.

sentences.line: Wait a minute. I'm not riding in that.
What?! This is a class ride, Johnson.
Yeah, if you're Superfly.
That's it! You can attack me, but when you attack my car, I cannot forgive! You in the back, girl!
sentences.followup: Lee gallantly opens the door for Johnson who reluctantly gets in the back seat. Lee starts to get back there with her.

sentences.line: (to Lee) Where the hell are you goin'?!
sentences.followup: Lee gets up front.

shots.desc: CHINESE FLAGS flutter over the event. Lots of sparkle. MEN in tuxedos and WOMEN in gowns are arriving. Over the entrance we see a huge banner - CHINESE EXPO.

Escalators move down to a huge room filled with art of all kinds, including huge sculptures, Chinese screens, glass and ceramic vases in large DISPLAY CASES. In fact, we may recognize some of the art from the opening bust in Hong Kong. Dominating the center of the room is a LARGE BUDDHA standing on the edge of a HUGE POOL filled with water. A REFRESHMENT STAND is doing brisk business. We see Ambassador Han and his wife circulating, shaking hands, talking. Trying their best not to show their tension and fear. Griffin is with them. Glass of wine in hand. Shaking hands and chatting. Whitney moves through the crowd of people. Keeping watch on Han. He glances across the room at Monroe. Monroe is also alert. But they are both in tuxes. And unless you knew they were FBI, you couldn't tell.
AGENTS monitor the event with video monitors and listening devices.
We see the Cadillac pull up with Carter, Johnson and Lee.

sentences.line: California License. Three people inside. African American male. Asian male.
Running plate.

shots.desc: Evans and Monroe, parked back from the entrance. Connected to the van by radio. Monroe perks up at the description.

sentences.line: African American male with Asian male? Monroe looks at Evans.
It can't be. Monroe picks up his binoculars --
Oh shit.

shots.desc: Carter, Lee and Johnson move over a red carpet and enter the Convention Center.

scenes.place: A ROOM ON THE SECOND FLOOR

shots.desc: SIX CERAMIC DRAGONS are being loaded with 200 million dollars in U.S. CASH. Russ watches as he gets the call.

sentences.line: Sir, we just identified Carter and Lee.
What?
They've just arrived. With a woman. We don't have an i.d. on her.
I want them picked up. NOW!

shots.desc: It banks over a freeway, heading for downtown.
Griffin looks at his watch. Glances across the room at ONE OF THE SECURITY GUARDS standing in the b.g. We see it's Sang. Griffin glances at TWO MORE SECURITY GUARDS. Shu and Chung.
A SOCIALITE crosses to him.

sentences.line: The exhibit is extraordinary, Mr. Ambassador. I hope this is just the beginning of more cultural exchanges between our two countries.
sentences.followup: Han forces a smile.

shots.desc: Carter, Lee and Johnson come down the escalator into the hall.
He gets some disturbing news over his ear phone.

sentences.line: (into radio) How the hell did they get here?
sentences.followup: Whitney turns quickly, scanning the crowd. But the place is packed. Black ties and gowns everywhere.

shots.desc: , JOHNSON, LEE They're walking past the exhibits.

sentences.line: Oh no.
What?
The art.
(to Lee) You don't like it?
It's okay. For restaurants.
No, it is China, my country, my history. If any of it gets damaged...
Hey, don't worry. Nothing's gonna happen to it. Carter turns and sees Griffin through the crowd.
Wait. That guy. I saw him outside the restaurant.
sentences.followup: Carter points through the crowd at Griffin. Lee is shocked.

sentences.line: Oh my god. Griffin.
You know him?
sentences.followup: But Lee is already moving toward Griffin.

shots.desc: He's talking with someone when he happens to catch Lee moving towards him. He never loses his smile. Until he sees Lee mouth the word:

sentences.line: Juntao.
sentences.followup: Griffin looks around and sees Carter moving in from another direction. Griffin quickly excuses himself and heads for the escalator.

shots.desc: He spots Carter and Johnson moving towards the escalator as they follow Griffin.

sentences.line: (into RADIO) Wait. I see Carter. Request assistance immediately.
sentences.followup: Suddenly, Johnson appears at Whitney's side. She flashes her LAPD badge and says:

sentences.line: I got to talk to you. Now.

shots.desc: He moves to a PODIUM WITH A MICROPHONE that overlooks the room below.

sentences.line: Ladies and Gentlemen, can I have your attention please? The crowd hushes.

Welcome to Chinese Expo. The exhibit you see before you represents over a thousand years of Chinese art. Up until several months ago, most of this exhibit was in the hands of one private collector. (pause) Me. So, I should say more correctly, welcome to my exhibit.

shots.desc: He looks up with a puzzled expression at his friend.
He looks up at Griffin too as Johnson keeps filling him in.

sentences.line: Great collectors are born, not made. It took most of my life to find and catalog the priceless pieces you see. And then, in one fell swoop, they were taken from me. But tonight, I will be paid in full. Griffin holds up a DETONATOR.
A bomb is wired to Ambassador Han's daughter in a car outside.
sentences.followup: AUDIBLE GASPS from the floor. Carter immediately ducks down in the crowd and runs bent over for the exit.

shots.desc: He turns to his lapel mike. It's immediately ripped off his collar by Sang. Other agents on the floor are quickly stopped from communicating by Griffin's men.

sentences.line: No one moves! Lee stares up at Griffin trying to figure out what to do.

She will die if I push this button. But if you are all patient, my transportation will be here shortly and you can continue to enjoy my collection. Everyone just stay calm. (to Han) You just picked on the wrong guy, my friend.

shots.desc: Russ, unaware of the situation on the exhibit floor, continues to monitor the loading of the dragons.
Shu is leaning against the van in the parking lot.

sentences.line: You're parked in a red zone. facing Carter who has his gun out, pointed at him.
It's not red now, but you try anything, and it's gonna be blood red. Carter moves up to him, keeping the gun leveled.
Only one problem. I forgot my cuffs.
sentences.followup: He grabs Shu's head and slams it into the side of the van. Shu drops. Out cold. Carter pulls keys from Shu's pocket.

sentences.line: You have the right to remain silent alllll night.
sentences.followup: Carter moves to the back of the van. Looks at the LICENSE. CALIFORNIA. LIK. Unlocks the back door. Stands back, ready to shoot, as he opens the door. Looks in.

shots.desc: She's in the back of the van. Black hood over her face. She's wearing a BULKY VEST that is covered with plastic explosive. Carter pulls the hood off.

sentences.line: Hi. Detective Carter, LAPD. Let's get this thing off you.
(near tears) NO! Don't touch it! I heard them say it will explode. Carter hesitates.

shots.desc: Griffin stands at the podium, still holding the detonator high so everyone can see it. He speaks quietly into his lapel mike.

sentences.line: Where are you?

shots.desc: The pilot keys his mike. Three minutes.
Griffin nods to Sang down on the floor. Sang starts moving up the escalator.

sentences.line: Thank you, ladies and gentlemen. We'll be calling this an evening.
sentences.followup: Suddenly we HEAR a CLATTER AND RUMBLE. Low at first, but building LOUDER and LOUDER. Everyone turns. THROUGH THE PLATE GLASS WINDOW we can SEE THE VAN tearing up the museum steps. Right toward the window. And it's not stopping.

shots.desc: It crashes RIGHT INTO THE WINDOW. Everyone scatters. The Van roars into the hall. It knocks over a huge DISPLAY CASE scattering glass everywhere. Finally, it RAMS the refreshment booth and stops in the middle of the room. The BACK DOORS OPEN and Carter steps out with Soon Young who is still wearing the bomb.

sentences.line: (to Griffin) Okay, asshole, here's your bomb. You wanna blow somebody up, go ahead. Push the button. Let's blow everybody up.
sentences.followup: Everyone who didn't panic before, does now. People start running.

sentences.line: Soon Young!
sentences.followup: An FBI AGENT grabs Han and his wife and pushes them down on the floor. Lee and Johnson run to Soon Young's side.

shots.desc: For the first time, he looks scared. He turns away from the podium and runs. Sang turns on the escalator, pulls a MAC 10 and sprays the room. FBI agents on the floor take cover behind the priceless art work, pull guns and start firing. Griffin's men return fire as the last of the black tie crowd hit the deck. Johnson grabs Soon Young and ducks back in the van with Lee.

The last of the money is being loaded from one remaining suitcase and put into the dragons by two agents. Russ watches. Suddenly, Griffin runs into the room and opens fire with a nine millimeter. He hits the two agents doing the packing. Russ, totally taken by surprise, reaches for his weapon, but Russ cuts him down. Griffin grabs the last full suitcase and runs out.
Johnson is studying the bomb. Soon Young continues to whimper.

sentences.line: (to Soon Young) It's gonna be OK.
sentences.followup: The battle RAGES outside. Occasionally, the van is hit by gun fire.

sentences.line: Can you get it off?
sentences.followup: Johnson doesn't answer. Instead, she pulls a SWISS ARMY KNIFE out of her dainty purse, flips out the tiny scissors and cuts TWO WIRES leading to one of the CLASPS on the vest.

sentences.line: OK. Lee helps her take the vest off. Johnson hands it to Lee.
Get rid of it. The detonator can still set it off. And this... She points to a SWITCH on the front of the vest.
Don't touch. It's a back up. Short fuse. Five...maybe ten seconds.
I'll cover you.
sentences.followup: At that moment, the van is hit hard with automatic fire. Johnson throws herself over Soon Young as Carter and Lee dive out the back door.

shots.desc: Carter and Lee jump behind the Buddha. Gunfire erupts from all quarters.

sentences.line: (to Lee) Go!
sentences.followup: Lee takes off for the escalator. He runs half way up when Russ appears at the top. He's bleeding badly and staggering.

sentences.line: (to Lee) Griffin...the elevator.
sentences.followup: Russ collapses. Lee looks up. A hundred and fifty feet above him, we see a catwalk below the skylights that make up the roof. The catwalk leads to AN OPEN ROOF DOOR. Lee scans the ceiling and spots an ENCLOSED LADDER that leads all the way up to the catwalk. He takes off.

shots.desc: Griffin keys his mike.

sentences.line: (into radio) Plan B. Meet me on the roof.

shots.desc: The pilot is just getting ready to set the chopper down in the parking lot. He aborts and pulls full power. The chopper starts to rise.
Lee reaches the ladder, PUTS THE BOMB JACKET ON and starts climbing.
He runs up the escalator and bends down to Russ. He's alive but hurt bad. Carter turns and sees SANG running and firing BELOW HIM. Carter leaps off the escalator and lands on Sang.
Griffin looks down at the detonator in his hand. For a second he looks like he's going to push the button. But he hesitates.
Lee is flying up it at superhuman speed. When the inside ladder proves too slow, he switches to the outside GUARD CAGE and climbs that.
Sang is kicking the shit out of Carter. Carter gets in one punch and Sang hits him three times and sweeps his feet out from under him.

The doors open and Griffin walks out onto the catwalk that runs just below the ceiling. He looks down. GRIFFIN'S POV Below him, the battle still rages, but FBI agents are getting the upper hand. Griffin holds up the detonator. His thumb covers the button.

sentences.line: Looking for this?
sentences.followup: Griffin looks up and sees Lee, breathing hard, on the other side of the catwalk. He's pointing to the bomb that he's wearing. Griffin fires two shots at Lee that ricochet off the catwalk railing. Lee hits the floor of the catwalk.

shots.desc: Two of Griffin's men are cut down by Whitney as they try to escape up the escalator.
Sang KICKS Carter in the face and he goes down. Sang practically stumbles over Carter's gun and picks it up. Carter staggers to his feet. Sang points the gun at Carter and cocks it.

sentences.line: That's my gun, mother fucker.
sentences.followup: Carter's hands fly, doing Lee's routine. Suddenly, the gun ends up in Carter's hands. Sang leaps for the gun. Carter drills him in the forehead.

shots.desc: Griffin fires at Lee as he tries to make his way around to the roof door. Lee CRAWLS. Suddenly, a ROAR starts a second before we see the CHOPPER rise into a hover. Griffin runs around the catwalk for the door. Lee looks up and sees a ROPE AND PULLEY hanging over the abyss. He leaps for the railing and dives out into space. He catches the rope and starts riding it to the other side of the catwalk. Griffin sees him coming and fires on the run. He misses. Clicks. The gun is empty. He throws his gun and hits Lee in the HEAD with it. Lee almost falls and then:

Things are under the control of the FBI. Carter is holstering his gun when he hears Griffin's shot. And then a second later, the gun smashes into the marble floor. He looks up and sees them fighting on the catwalk.

Griffin tries to push a groggy Lee off him but he won't let go of his legs. Griffin starts beating Lee over the head with the suitcase. It POPS open and ten million dollars flutters out like confetti. Lee pushes through the money, stands up and grabs Griffin. Griffin tries to get away and HITS THE SWITCH ON THE JACKET. They both stop and look at each other in panic. Then Griffin HEAD BUTTS Lee. Lee starts to go down, but instead, he HEAD BUTTS Griffin back. Griffin crumples. Lee holds him, wriggles out of the vest and PUTS IT ON GRIFFIN. Then he looks down, tips them both over the railing and THEY FALL. WHACK! Lee grabs THE BOTTOM OF THE CATWALK as he goes by. Unfortunately, Griffin woke up and is holding onto Lee's foot. Lee kicks once. Twice. The third is a charm. Griffin falls backwards toward THE BUDDHA POOL. He falls and falls, all the while looking back up at Lee. He hits with a huge splash. CLOSE ON Griffin's face under water. He's still alive. KABOOM!
key_words: HITS THE SWITCH ON THE JACKET

shots.desc: A SHOWER OF WATER falls over the hall. Everybody gets wet.
The FBI is escorting the bad guys out of the building. Sang is escorted out by the CORONER. Han approaches Lee. Extends his hand.

sentences.line: I owe you everything.
Only your friendship. Lee looks around at all the BROKEN ART.
It is so sad. So much beauty ruined. So much of our culture gone. Yes. But... (pointing) Life goes on.
sentences.followup: He's pointing to Soon Young who is in the arms of her mother. Lee smiles.

shots.desc: He's standing next to Whitney at the top of the escalator. Both Carter and Whitney are SOAKING WET from the water explosion. Whitney is just hanging up a cellular.

sentences.line: (to Carter) He'll be OK. Russ is a tough son of a bitch.
Tell me about it.
He was just doing his job.
So was I.
And me too.
sentences.followup: Lee is standing behind Whitney. Whitney looks a little embarrassed now.

sentences.line: (mumbling) And the FBI appreciates it. Whitney walks away.
Prick.
sentences.followup: Carter looks at Lee and points up to the ladder that leads to the catwalk.

sentences.line: You got circus blood in you?
Shortcut.
sentences.followup: Carter laughs and looks down the escalator.

shots.desc: She's sitting on the last step. She's SOAKING WET too. Her hair and dress are ruined. She looks depressed. Carter walks down to her. You OK?

sentences.line: We saved the girl and got the bad guys, didn't we?
Yeah. So why you look do down?
Look at me! My dress is ruined. I look like shit.
Not to me. Never to me. Johnson stares at him for a long beat.
How about a lift home?
Absolutely. I'll even let you ride in the front seat.

shots.desc: Lee is seated, eyes closed, listening to MUSIC over his headphones. Carter walks down the aisle and takes the seat next to him.

sentences.line: Yo, what's up? Lee opens his eyes. Smiles.
What a surprise!
FBI calls up my ass, says they need help in Tokyo. Like I'm supposed to drop everything.
It's Hong Kong, not Tokyo. My country asked for the best. I told them that was you. Now I will show you around my hood.
No shark fin, no camel hump. (re: CD player) What you listenin' to?
Oh, I think you like this very much.
sentences.followup: Carter puts on the head phones. We HEAR the first few bars of HELP ME THE 747 -- CONTINUOUS glides toward Hong Kong to the All-American music of the Beach Boys.
